text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour, as the transposition of these measures into UNION law prevents, discourages and eliminates illegal fishing. This will ensure better conservation and optimum use of fish stocks in the North-East Atlantic area, producing lasting environmental and social results.

name: Monika Flašíková Beňová (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 Fishing, as one of the most important sectors for several Member States of the European Union, also needs to take measures in the area of control and rules for its respective species. The North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC) has proposed to incorporate into European Union law changes to the system that will become binding on its Contracting Parties and, consequently, on the European Union. In particular, it is about harmonising the system to prevent illegal unreported and unregulated fishing. The main amendment to this Regulation is also a measure to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal exploitation of fishery resources, which will ensure, from an environmental and social point of view, sustainable development in this industry.

name: Lorenzo Fontana (ENF)
text: in writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of amending Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 on the alignment of the FAO agreement on measures concerning the port state competence control system in order to prevent, deter and eliminate illegal, undeclared and unregulated fishing.

name: Λάμπρος Φουντούλης (
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of this report because it is moving in the right direction, resolving issues arising in these fishing areas.

name: Doru-Claudian Frunzulică (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 is amended in order to incorporate three NEAFC (North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission) Recommendations which have become binding for the Contracting Parties to NEAFC and consequently for the EU. The Scheme will include further measures to help the fight against IUU fishing; other changes concern new provisions for transhipment operations as well as revised notification procedures.

name: Francesc Gambús (PPE)
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the proposal for a Regulation to ensure long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area and to provide sustainable, environmental and social benefits. The measures envisaged will ensure better long-term conservation of the North-East Atlantic area.

name: Arne Gericke (ECR)
text: Writing. I voted today in favour of the report on the control and enforcement regime applicable in the field of fisheries in the North-East Atlantic, as I believe that rules that protect our fish stocks and, at the same time, are well applicable, especially for small and medium-sized maritime enterprises.

name: Jens Gieseke (PPE)
text: Writing. Sustainable use of fish resources in the North-East Atlantic is important to meet our environmental responsibilities. Future generations should also be able to benefit from the wealth of the seas. With this report, we are making a decisive contribution to this.

name: Neena Gill (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this proposal  for an amending regulation to lay down a scheme of control and enforcement in the area covered by the Convention on future multilateral cooperation in the Northeast Atlantic fisheries, which will ensure a better long-term conservation and optimum utilisation of fishery resources in the area of the Northeast Atlantic, bringing lasting environmental and social results.

name: Tania González Peñas (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. We voted IN FAVOUR because the proposal aims to improve legislation already adopted which seeks to ensure better long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, providing social and sustainable benefits for the environment.

name: Theresa Griffin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the scheme proposed here, because it is a sound proposal and will include further measures to help fight against illegal, unreported or unregulated fishing. This will guarantee that the fish from the North-East Atlantic that reaches the shop shelves in the West Midlands will be more ethically and sustainably sourced.

name: Brian Hayes (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for this report because the measures provided will ensure a better long-term conservation and optimum utilisation of fishery resources in the area of the North-East Atlantic. This will bring lasting results for the environment and also help create positive results in terms of social aspects. The long term conservation and optimum utilisation of the fishery resources of the North-East Atlantic area is crucial for the future of the EU.

name: Hans-Olaf Henkel (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ With this proposal, the measures which have been signed up to in the NEAFC (North East Atlantic Fisheries Commission) Convention will be transposed into EU law. The measures will only apply to the North East corner of the Atlantic, and deal with communication of transhipments and port landings, provisions for Port State Control and aspects of foreign fishing vessels and infringement procedures. These measures are already applicable to the member states, and therefore the Regulation's purpose is to give additional legal certainty and to fulfil the EU's international obligations, which is why I have voted in favour of this proposal. By the way, I believe that the Euro must be abolished. It leads to dissension and discord in Europe.

name: Cătălin Sorin Ivan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report that will align the scheme with the FAO Agreement on Port State Measures to prevent, deter and eliminate Illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing, approved by the EU in 2011 and instated since 1 July 2015.

name: Ivan Jakovčić (ALDE)
text: Written. ‒ I voted for the European Parliament's draft legislative resolution on the proposal for a regulation by Parliament and the Council amending the Regulation on a system of control and enforcement variable in the area covered by the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in North East Atlantic Fisheries, as this implements the transfer of recommendations adopted under neafc to EU law.  In this context, I fully support efforts to preserve and make optimal use of fishing resources in the North East Atlantic to contribute to the environment, society, growth and sustainability. Therefore, I believe it is of particular importance to prevent and eliminate the practices of illegal, unregulated and unreported fishing, and I support this report accordingly.

name: Jean-François Jalkh (ENF)
text: In writing. This text is based on the observation that port states are increasingly being relied upon to combat illegal fishing because flag states do not effectively control fishing operations. States may take the following steps: obligations to notify prior to entry to the port; restrictions on port entry and fish landings or transfers; restrictions on supplies and services Documentation requirements to be provided Inspections Establishing a blacklist of ships; trade measures and sanctions.  The purpose of this text is to implement recommendations from the Northeast Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAC) to make the fight against illegal fishing more efficient. This text therefore stresses the position of the States of the landing port, which is better able to monitor fishing vessels. I voted for it.

name: Diane James (EFDD)
text: in writing. – Whilst we are in favour of building fish stocks, my colleagues and I oppose the EU signing international agreements like a sovereign nation.

name: Marc Joulaud (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of my colleague Ole Christensen's report on the control and coercion regime in the Northeast Atlantic fisheries. The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in Northeast Atlantic Fisheries aims to conserve fisheries resources through reasoned use of fishing in the north-east Atlantic. I have therefore endorsed the European Commission's proposal to incorporate the convention's recommendations into European law, as the European Union is a contracting party.

name: Jarosław Kalinowski (PPE)
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 One of the fundamental issues on which the EU fisheries sector must focus is to ensure the conservation and optimal use of the environmental resources of the North-East Atlantic. To this end, it is proposed to introduce into European legislation the amendments recommended by the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC). The proposed amendments address two key issues : the adaptation of measures to prevent illegal fishing by the port State with the arrangements of the Agreement concluded with the Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) and the obligation to inform each vessel of its destination port of unloading, even outside the convention area.  These actions aim at adapting EU law to the current challenges facing European fisheries, namely the need to maintain biological balance in marine areas and protect endangered organisms, including the hugely popular Atlantic cod , a close relative of "Polish" Baltic cod (which is also at risk). These are necessary measures, but the question arises: why is this happening only in the face of a threat? Shouldn't we prevent the destruction of natural ecosystems rather than repairing them afterwards? We must bear this in mind not only because of the current state of affairs, but also for future generations who may pay a high price for our sluggery.

name: Barbara Kappel (ENF)
text: Writing. I believe that the proposed measures are effective and correct. I am therefore voting in favour of this proposal.

name: Afzal Khan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the proposal as its key aspect is to support the elimination of illegal, unreported or unregulated fishing. Such fishing causes considerable environmental and economic loss and has a wider impact on the livelihoods and food security of coastal populations.

name: Giovanni La Via (PPE)
text: in writing. The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in the North-East Atlantic Fisheries aims to ensure the optimum use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, with lasting environmental and social benefits. Therefore, in order to fully implement the Convention, it will be possible to adopt control measures to discourage and eliminate illegal, undeclared and unregulated fishing.

name: Marine Le Pen (ENF)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the report on the control and coercion regime for the Northeast Atlantic fisheries. The objective is the conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the Northeast Atlantic region through the control and enforcement regime adopted by the Northeast Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAC). In particular, the text aims to combat illegal fishing through control measures when landing in a port of a Member State. It is essentially a matter of transposing cpaNE recommendations to improve the fight against illegal fishing. The main focus is on the landing port states, which are more capable of monitoring ships, than the flag states.

name: Gilles Lebreton (ENF)
text: In writing. FN MEPs voted in favour of this text because it improves the fight against illegal fishing by involving the states of the landing ports, not just the flag states of the offending boats. The fight against illegal fishing is fundamental to defending the interests of French fishermen.

name: Antonio López-Istúriz White (PPE)
text: in writing. The European Union is a contracting party to the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in North-East Atlantic Fishing Grounds.  The main purpose of this Convention is the conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in this area to provide sustainable, environmental and social benefits.  This report aims to ensure the implementation of this Convention and to make certain critical recommendations and comments to improve different aspects. Among the new measures proposed we highlight the establishment of a Community control regime to ensure compliance with the rules of the common fisheries policy and a Community system to prevent and eliminate illegal, undeclared and unregulated fishing. With regard to the latter aspect, Parliament is awaiting the Commission's proposals. Because these are rational measures that would increase legality and control in the fisheries field, I consider the adoption of this report feasible.

name: Petr Mach (EFDD)
text: Writing. \u2012 The European Union should not interfere with national states' fisheries policy.

name: Andrejs Mamikins (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 Fishing has always occupied an important place in the everyday lives of European citizens. Today is undeniably no exception: this sector in the European Commission, Parliament and council has its own relevant structural components, whose activities are aimed at general regulation and reform in the case of necessity. It is therefore important that the legal principles and rules applicable to fisheries are constantly updated in line with newly admitted commitments by the European Union. The north-east Atlantic fishing area is one of the world's largest and richest existing resources. It also plays an important role in our community's fishing industry. Consequently, amending Regulation No 1236/2010 to combat illegal, undeclared and unregulated fisheries and to systematise more effectively the operation of vessels in the sector in cases of transhipment is necessary for further development of the area and for its synchronisation with the European Union's international obligations. Above all, however, any such changes have a positive impact on the well-being of the workforce involved, while contributing to the conservation of species.

name: Νότης Μαριάς (
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am abstaining from voting on the report on the proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EU) No 1493/1999. 1236/2010 of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a control and enforcement system applicable in the convention area for future multilateral cooperation in the fisheries sector in the North-East Atlantic, because it is neither complete nor documented.

name: David Martin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for this proposal. The main amendment to Regulation 1236/2010 concerns the alignment of the FAO Agreement control system on measures pertaining to port State competencies in order to prevent, deter and eliminate IUU fishing. The measures provided by this amendment will ensure a better long-term conservation and optimum utilization of fishery resources in the area of the Northeast Atlantic, bringing lasting results under the environmental and social aspects.

name: Dominique Martin (ENF)
text: In writing. I voted for this text. The aim here is to transpose the recommendations of the CPANE, the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission, into EU law, via Parliament and the Council. These recommendations will help combat illegal fishing based on measures taken by landing ports that are better able to monitor vessels. These measures include: the requirement for prior notification of entry or use of the port, restrictions on landings or transshipments, inspections, trade measures and sanctions, etc.

name: Fulvio Martusciello (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in the North-East Atlantic Fisheries, to which the European Union is a contracting party, is intended to ensure the long-term conservation and optimum use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, producing lasting environmental benefits.  The proposal is aimed at amending Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 in order to transpose into Union law the changes to the regime adopted in the recommendations of NEAFC 15/2013 and 9/2014. The measures provided for in this amendment will ensure better long-term conservation and optimum use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, producing lasting environmental and social results.

name: Barbara Matera (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in the North-East Atlantic Fisheries has been concluded, to which the European Union is a contracting party. It must ensure and make optimum use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, producing lasting environmental and social benefits. I am voting in favour of the proposal to adopt control and coercion measures in order to ensure the application of this Convention, in the general interest of the Union.

name: Gabriel Mato (PPE)
text: in writing. U2012 I support the report on the proposal to amend the Regulation establishing a control and enforcement regime applicable in the area of the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in North-East Atlantic Fishing Grounds. The purpose of this Convention is to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area and to provide sustainable, environmental and social benefits, so improvements to the Regulation for its implementation will be important in ensuring its proper management.

name: Georg Mayer (ENF)
text: Writing. The report appears to be promising in order to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of the north-east Atlantic fisheries resources, thereby creating sustainable environmental and social benefits. I therefore agree with this report.

name: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (GUE/NGL)
text: In writing. The report presented aims to incorporate international regulations on the reporting and control of vessels involved in transshipment operations into EU law. Transshipment is a common operation to unload at sea the catches of a vessel that remains in fishing action on another that is about to disembark at the port. These operations lead to a discontinuity between the fishing vessel and the landing vessel. Indeed, they can be conducted in international waters and sometimes between two ships of different flags. This potentially complicates control and police operations. They make systematic declarations at the landing port mandatory for both vessels participating in a transshipment operation and for receiving vessels. The system therefore restores the traceability of the fish and therefore increases the efficiency of the controls. I'm voting for.

name: Joëlle Mélin (ENF)
text: In writing. This text is based on the observation that port states are increasingly being relied upon to combat illegal fishing because flag states do not effectively control fishing operations. States may take the following steps: obligations to notify prior to entry to the port; restrictions on port entry and fish landings or transfers; restrictions on supplies and services Documentation requirements to be provided Inspections Establishing a blacklist of ships; trade measures and sanctions.  The purpose of this text is to implement recommendations from the Northeast Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAC) to make the fight against illegal fishing more efficient. This text therefore stresses the position of the States of the landing port, which is better able to monitor fishing vessels. I voted for it.

name: Nuno Melo (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 This proposal aims to amend the EU rules transpose the control and coertion regime adopted by the North East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC). The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in North-East Atlantic Fisheries, in which the European Union is a Contracting Party, aims, as the European Commission states, to ensure long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic area, providing sustainable environmental and social benefits. I presented my concordant vote.

name: Roberta Metsola (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ The EU has promised to ensure that the long-term conservation and optimal use of marine resources will be implemented in the North East Atlantic. I chose to support this proposal as it seeks to amend Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 to incorporate it into Union law ensuring sustainable, environmental and social aspects are looked at in fisheries policies.

name: Louis Michel (ALDE)
text: In writing. I welcome the position taken by the European Parliament on the proposed amendment to the regulation on the control and coercion regime applicable in the North-East Atlantic fisheries. The aim is to incorporate into European law the recent recommendations of the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission, which include the essential issue of combating illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing. In view of the damage caused by this fishery and the threat it poses to the sustainability of fish stocks, the Union must redouble its efforts and cooperate closely at the international level to eradicate these activities as soon as possible.

name: Marlene Mizzi (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the scheme of control and enforcement applicable in the North-East Atlantic fisheries, which seeks to amend Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 in order to incorporate NEAFC (North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission) Recommendations 15/2013 and 9/2014 as amended by Recommendation 12/2015, which have become binding on the contracting parties to NEAFC and consequently on the EU.

name: Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in Fisheries of the North-East Atlantic aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the Northeast Atlantic area. I consider it important to transpose into EU law the recommendations adopted within neafc, in particular the alignment of the scheme with the FAO agreement on port state measures to prevent, prevent and eliminate illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing (IUU fishing). I believe that these measures will allow long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the Northeast Atlantic area, providing lasting environmental and social advantages. I endorse the rapporteur's position on short adoption deadlines which hinder the legislative work of Parliament and the Council and undermine the legislative quality.

name: Sophie Montel (ENF)
text: In writing. The purpose of this report is the conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the Northeast Atlantic region through the control and coercion regime adopted by the Northeast Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAC). In particular, it aims to combat illegal fishing through control measures when landing in a port of a Member State. The CPANE's recommendations are transposed into EU law.  Given that the main aim is to transpose recommendations from the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAC) to improve the fight against illegal fishing and that the landing port states are directly associated because they are better able to monitor ships than flag states, I voted in favour of this text.

name: Claude Moraes (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report, which will lay down a scheme of control and enforcement in the area covered by the Convention on future multilateral cooperation in the Northeast Atlantic fisheries. A key aspect of the proposal is to support the elimination of IUU fishing. Such fishing causes considerable environmental and economic loss and has a wider impact on the livelihoods and food security of coastal populations. It is difficult to determine the cost of IUU fishing, but it is estimated that it costs the global economy 22 billion euros per year. Such pirate fishing also causes significant environmental damage, with fishers usually identifying commercially valuable species that have been caught, and discarding the remainder – often as much as 75% of the total catch.

name: Nadine Morano (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text on the control and coercion regime applicable in the field of fisheries. The aim is to introduce into European law the recommendations of the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in North-East Atlantic Fisheries (CPANE), which the Union has supported as a contracting party. These recommendations include the communication of transshipments and the control of foreign fishing vessels. The goal of THE CPANE is to ensure the optimal conservation and use of fisheries resources in the Northeast Atlantic region to ensure the long-term economic and social benefits of fishing and environmental protection.

name: Elisabeth Morin-Chartier (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of Mr Ole Christensen's report on the control and coercion regime in the North-East Atlantic fisheries. The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in Northeast Atlantic Fisheries, of which the European Union is a contracting party, aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic region, in order to bring economic, environmental and social benefits. The CPANE's recommendations are binding and must be transposed into EU law. At its annual meetings in 2012, 2013 and 2014, the CPANE adopted a number of recommendations. These were adopted by the CPANE with the support of the Union. They must now be incorporated into EU law through the proposed regulation.

name: József Nagy (PPE)
text: Writing. \u2012 In the future, we must place even greater emphasis on the rational use of our natural resources, and I am therefore happy to support any effort that has a positive impact on this subject. The long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the north-east Atlantic is in the pan-European interest, which is why it is important to take more effective action against undeclared and unregulated fishing and unregulated loading and unregulated cargo.

name: Victor Negrescu (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ The European Union is a contracting party of the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in Northeast Atlantic Fisheries, which aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimum utilisation of the fishery resources of the north-east Atlantic area, providing sustainable environmental and social benefits. I have voted for this report that will establish the principle that vessels involved in a trans-shipment operation in the regulatory area as the receiving vessel must communicate the port of landing regardless of whether the landing is to take place in a port inside or outside the Convention area.

name: Urmas Paet (ALDE)
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported. The measures aim to ensure better long-term conservation and optimal exploitation of fish stocks in the North-East Atlantic region.

name: Rolandas Paksas (EFDD)
text: Writing. – I voted in favour of this report.  It is necessary to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal exploitation of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic region. It is also possible to prevent, deter and eliminate illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing.  It should be noted that the economic viability of the fishing sector depends on the sustainable exploitation of marine resources, the management, conservation and recovery of fish stocks, rational planning and surveillance.  Fisheries policy must bring benefits both to the environment and to society. It is therefore essential to transpose the recommendations adopted by the NEAFC into the EU legal order and to implement them as soon as possible. Only an effective common control and enforcement framework will ensure sustainability, enable sustainable economic and social development and promote the competitiveness of the fisheries sector.

name: Margot Parker (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ Whilst we are in favour of building fish stocks, we oppose the EU signing international agreements like a sovereign nation.

name: Aldo Patriciello (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I believe that an agreement such as the one we are discussing is of fundamental importance, especially in order to protect the environment, a very topical issue that also results from the final document of COP21 drawn up a few days ago. I feel obliged to vote in favour.

name: Marijana Petir (PPE)
text: Written. ‒The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in Northeast Atlantic Fisheries, which is a European Union Contracting Party, aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal exploitation of fishing resources in the northeastern Atlantic region, providing sustainable, environmental and social benefits. In order to ensure the application of this Convention and the recommendations it has adopted, the North East Atlantic Commission (NEAFC), may adopt control and enforcement measures relating to fisheries concerned.  Regulation 1236/2010/EU transposes into the EU the legislation of the Control and Enforcement Scheme established by the Convention. I supported this legislative resolution, as the proposed amendment to Regulation 1236/2010/EU transces into European legislation the new recommendations necessary for the efficient management of fishing resources in the North Atlantic, which are necessary for better cooperation between competent authorities and fishermen.  The last recommendation of June 2015 concerns, for example, the introduction of a new electronic data exchange system. Notification of surveillance of foreign fishing vessels by state authorities in ports has been adapted to the transition from a previous system based on written reports to a modern web-based application managed by the NEAFC Secretariat.

name: Florian Philippot (ENF)
text: In writing. The purpose of this report is the conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the Northeast Atlantic region through the control and coercion regime adopted by the Northeast Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAC). In particular, it aims to combat illegal fishing through control measures when landing in a port of a Member State. The CPANE's recommendations are transposed into EU law. Given that the main aim is to transpose recommendations from the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAC) to improve the fight against illegal fishing and that the landing port states are directly associated because they are better able to monitor ships than flag states, I voted in favour of this text.

name: Tonino Picula (S&D)
text: Written. ‒ I support the incorporation of the Commission's recommendations for fisheries in the North East Atlantic into Union regulation with a view to the long-term protection and optimal use of fish stocks in the northeast area, and with a view to achieving sustainability, environmental protection and other social benefits. The main amendments concern the adaptation of certain competences and regulations to make it more effective to combat illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and changes in transport and reporting procedures.

name: Andrej Plenković (PPE)
text: Written. - I support the report on the proposal for a Regulation by the European Parliament and the Council amending Regulation (EU) No 1009/2013. 1236/2010 of the European Parliament and the Council on the control and enforcement system applicable in the area covered by the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in Fisheries of the Northeast Atlantic proposed by Ole Christensen.  I consider this report positive, as the measures provided for in this amendment will ensure better long-term conservation and optimal use of fishing resources in the Northeast Atlantic, delivering lasting results towards environmental and social aspects.

name: Salvatore Domenico Pogliese (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 This proposal aims to amend the Eu ropean Union rules transposing the control and coercion regime adopted by the North East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC). In particular, Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 is amended in order to transpose into European Union law the changes to the regime adopted in the recommendations of NEAFC 15/2013 and 9/2014, as amended by Recommendation 12/2015, which have become binding on the contracting parties to the NEAFC Convention and, consequently, on the European Union. I voted in favour of this draft report because the main amendment, 9/2014, concerns the alignment of the scheme with the FAO (Food and Agriculture Organisation) agreement on port state measures to prevent, deter and eliminate illegal, undeclared and unregulated fishing, which was approved by the EU in 2011. These measures will ensure better long-term conservation and optimum use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, producing lasting environmental and social results. The proposal is in line with the model of the sustainable exploitation of fishery resources in accordance with the objectives of the Common European Fisheries Policy.

name: Franck Proust (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report because it is a technical transposition of binding recommendations So we need to update our legislation quickly, particularly for fisheries policy and precisely future multilateral cooperation in the North-East Atlantic fisheries.

name: Julia Reid (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ Whilst we are in favour of building fish stocks, we oppose the EU signing international agreements like a sovereign nation.

name: Claude Rolin (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report which introduces new measures that should have already been included in the Council Regulation (EC)no-1224/2009 of 20 November 2009 establishing a Community regime to ensure compliance with the rules of the Common Fisheries Policy and Regulation (EC) No. 1005/2008 of the Council of 29 September 2008 establishing a Community system to prevent, deter and eradicate illegal fishing, unreported and unregulated, for which the European Parliament is awaiting the Commission's proposals to carry out the necessary revision.

name: Fernando Ruas (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 This proposal for an amendment to Regulation No 1236/2010 voted in favour today is to adopt measures for the control and exercise of coertion with a view to ensuring long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic area, providing greater balances to the ecosystems concerned, as well as sustainable environmental preservation levels and lasting socio-economic benefits. This regulatory change follows several recommendations from the North East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC), dated 2012, 2013 and 2015, and it is in the Union's interest as a Contracting Party that these measures be implemented by them. Ensuring the applicability of this Convention, which incorporates measures involving greater control of fisheries with a view to eliminating illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing, led me to vote in favour of this report.

name: Tokia Saïfi (PPE)
text: In writing. The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in North-East Atlantic Fisheries (CPANE), of which the European Union is a contracting party, aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic area, in order to bring economic, environmental and social benefits. The CPANE's recommendations are binding and must be transposed into EU law. I therefore voted in favour of this text, which aims to incorporate into a European regulation the amendments made by the recommendations of the CPANE. These include the communication of transshipments and the landing port, a number of provisions relating to state control of the port of foreign fishing vessels, and infringement procedures.

name: Massimiliano Salini (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on the control and coercion regime applicable to fisheries in the North-East Atlantic, as I believe that the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in the North-East Atlantic Fisheries can ensure optimum use of fishery resources. I agree to establish a system of inspection and surveillance of fishing activities in order to prevent, deter and eliminate illegal, undeclared and unregulated fishing.

name: Lola Sánchez Caldentey (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – We voted IN FAVOUR because the proposal aims to improve legislation already adopted which seeks to ensure better long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, providing social and sustainable benefits for the environment.

name: Lidia Senra Rodríguez (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in North-East Atlantic Fishing Grounds, of which the EU is a Contracting Party, aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic and to bring sustainable, environmental and social benefits. Pursuant to that Convention and the recommendations adopted by the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission ( CPANE), control and enforcement measures may be taken concerning the fishing grounds concerned. The purpose of this proposal is to amend Regulation (EU) 1236/2010 in order to incorporate into EU law the amendments to the Scheme approved in the UNATHING. The main changes introduced by these Recommendations concern the conformity of the Regime with the FAO Agreement on Port State Measures to Prevent, Discourage and Eliminate IEDNR Fishing, as well as the clarification that any vessel participating in a transhipment operation in the regulatory area as a receiving vessel shall communicate the landing port regardless of w;disembarkation at a port located within or outside the Convention area. Taking into account the matter, and that it seeks to change legislation already adopted, we voted in favour.

name: Remo Sernagiotto (ECR)
text: in writing. \u2012 The proposal for a regulation adopted today by Parliament incorporates into Union law a number of recommendations adopted by the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC) on control and coercion. The main changes concern the communication of transhipments and ports of landing, the control of foreign vessels by the port State and infringement procedures. These measures will apply to the area of the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in the North-East Atlantic Fisheries in order to prevent, deter and eliminate illegal, undeclared and unregulated fishing; better long-term conservation and optimum use of fishery resources will also be ensured. For these reasons, I voted in favour.

name: Ricardo Serrão Santos (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 I agree with the content of this report. In fact, I agree with the alignment with the FAO regime on port state measures to prevent, prevent and eliminate illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing. I also agree that the measures provided for in this amendment will ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic area, providing lasting environmental and social benefits. Every coordinated effort to better manage fisheries and combat fraud is supported by me.

name: Jill Seymour (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this proposal as this is a EU jump to take over sovereignty. I do however wish to see the fish stocks protected.

name: Siôn Simon (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I would like to thank my colleague Ole Christensen for the fantastic work he has done on this as rapporteur. I voted in favour of the scheme proposed here, because it is a sound proposal and will include further measures to help fight against illegal, unreported or unregulated fishing. This will guarantee that the fish from the North-East Atlantic that reaches the shop shelves in the West Midlands will be more ethically and sustainably sourced.

name: Monika Smolková (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the motion for a resolution on the control and enforcement system applicable to north-east Atlantic fisheries, because the EU, as a contracting party, aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal exploitation of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic, as well as sustainable, environmental and social benefits. The main objective is to prevent, deter and eliminate illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing.  Another amendment clarifies that vessels to which catches are translated as receiving vessels in the Regulatory Area are obliged to report the port of landing, regardless of whether the port of landing is located within or outside the Convention area. The motion for a resolution also includes a recommendation amending the procedure for notifying port State controls of foreign fishing vessels in order to adapt them to the transition from a paper system to a modern ICT web application operated by the NEAFC.

name: Igor Šoltes (Verts/ALE)
text: Writing. The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in the North-East Atlantic Fisheries aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal utilisation of the north-east Atlantic fishery resources, while ensuring sustainable, environmental and social benefits.  The North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC) is the authority competent to ensure the application of the aforementioned Convention and may, to that end, issue recommendations and measures relating to control and enforcement in the fisheries sector. From 2012 to 2015, NEAFC adopted a number of reports supported by the EU and it is in its interest to incorporate these recommendations into EU law.   The report proposes to amend Regulation (EU) 1236/2010 so that it is aligned with the FAO Monitoring System (Code of Conduct for Responsible Fisheries). Harmonisation concerns, in particular, measures concerning national port jurisdictions and the prevention, restriction and elimination of illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing.  As the measures taken from these amendments will ensure better long-term conservation and optimal exploitation of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic area, I supported the report.

name: Davor Ivo Stier (PPE)
text: Written. I support this proposal because I think it is important to improve and continuously improve multilateral cooperation, including the Convention on Fisheries Cooperation in the Northeast Atlantic. I support the proposed changes, as this will improve cooperation between the European Union and countries in the North East Atlantic with a large fish stock.  I also consider a positive change in the digitization of equipment and registration to the system electronically, which will improve efficiency in environmental and social terms. I believe that this proposal will improve the control and application of fisheries laws in this area.

name: Dubravka Šuica (PPE)
text: Written. ‒ The European Union is a contracting party to the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in Fisheries of the Northeast Atlantic, which aims to preserve and make optimal use of the fishing resources of the Northeast Atlantic in the long term, thereby contributing to the sustainable development, environmental protection and development of the local community.  In order to ensure the application of the Convention and recommendations of the Northeast Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC), control and enforcement measures may be adopted for fishing activities in that fishing area. The control and enforcement system shall contain such measures and shall apply to all vessels used or intended to be used to carry out fishing resource exploitation activities in the areas defined in the Convention.  I support the proposal for a Regulation by the European Parliament and the Council amending Regulation (EU) No 2020/2013. 1236/2010 of the European Parliament and the Council on the control and enforcement system applicable in the territory covered by the Convention, as I believe that the amendment to this Regulation will lay down certain specific control measures to monitor fishing activities in the area covered by the Convention, and complement the control measures provided for in Council Regulation (EC) No 100/2010. 1224/2009 and Council Regulation (EC) No 1224/2009. 1005/2008 establishing a Community system to prevent, combat and stop illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing.

name: Richard Sulík (ECR)
text: Writing. \u2012 Since the proposal only aims to transpose the measures already in place and increase legal certainty, I supported the proposal.

name: Patricija Šulin (PPE)
text: Writing. \ i voted in favour of the report on the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending the Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on the control and enforcement system applicable in the Convention area on future multilateral cooperation in the North-East Atlantic fisheries. The aim of the Regulation is to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area and to ensure sustainable, environmental and social benefits. The measures will ensure better long-term conservation of the North-East Atlantic area. I voted in favour of this legislative resolution because the proposed amendment to Regulation 1236/2010 is necessary for the efficient management of fisheries resources in the North Atlantic, which are essential for better cooperation between authorities and fishermen.

name: Kay Swinburne (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this regulation, which will strengthen the EU's approach to fisheries management in the North-East Atlantic; supporting international measures means that EU fisheries procedures can be considered of an international standard.

name: Νεοκλής Συλικιώτης (
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 We voted in favour of the report because it aims to amend the existing EU rules on the transposition of the control and enforcement system established by the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission. This amendment provides for the implementation of measures aimed at ensuring better conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the region, offering lasting results while taking into account environmental and social aspects.

name: Ελευθέριος Συναδινός (
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 This report is moving in the right direction, resolving issues arising in the fishing areas concerned.

name: Claudia Tapardel (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 Fishing is one of the essential economic activities carried out within the Member States of the European Union. One of the areas with the most significant contribution to the fishing quotas set annually by the European institutions is the Atlantic area. Fishing in this region is governed by the recently adopted Convention on Multilateral Cooperation for Fisheries in the North-East Atlantic, to which the European Union is a Contracting Party and one of the main supporters. The Convention aims at the long-term conservation and optimal use of fish resources in the North-East Atlantic area, as well as the generation of sustainable social and environmental benefits. The current document proposes the application of this Convention and the recommendations adopted by the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission by amending Regulation (EU) No 1493/1999. 1236/2010 to incorporate the provisions of the Convention into European law. The amendment involves aligning the system with the FAO Agreement on port State measures to prevent, deter and eliminate illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing, as well as clarification and computerised monitoring of the activity of vessels involved in transhipment operations.  I believe that the changes proposed by the current report make an important contribution to the rational exploitation of marine resources in the North-East Atlantic area. I therefore support the adoption of this document in its current form.

name: Marc Tarabella (S&D)
text: In writing. We welcome the transposition of the recommendations adopted by the CPANE into EU legislation. It was therefore normal for Parliament to vote in favour of the text.

name: Pavel Telička (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this resolution, which seeks the amendment of Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down a scheme of control and enforcement applicable in the area covered by the Convention on future multilateral cooperation in the North-East Atlantic fisheries. The Convention, to which the EU is a party, aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimum utilisation of the fishery resources of the North-East Atlantic area. Its Commission (NEAFC) adopted the scheme of control and enforcement, which the regulation transposes into EU law. The purpose of the amendment is to implement several recent recommendations by the NEAFC amending the scheme. The main change, under NEAFC Recommendation 9/2014, is the alignment of the scheme with the UN Food and Agriculture Organisation’s Port State Measures Agreement.

name: Ruža Tomašić (ECR)
text: Written. ‒ I supported a proposal transposition in European Union legislation of various measures covered by the Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in Fisheries of the Northeast Atlantic. These measures are directly applicable to Member States as they have been adopted by the North East Atlantic Fisheries Commission, of which the European Union is a member.  In my view, it is possible to protect fishing resources through proposed landing and transhipment measures, inspections at sea and breaches of procedures, supervision of fishing vessels flying the flag of another Contracting Party and through measures to promote compliance by non-contracting vessel, as this will ensure sustainable economic, social and environmental benefits.  The Member States covered by these measures are the United Kingdom, Ireland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Denmark, Germany, Sweden, France, Spain and Portugal, and some of the main commercial species for fishing in the North East Atlantic are annchovies, cod, hake, mackerel, herring, as well as a number of deep-sea species for which this regulation provides an additional legal basis.

name: Romana Tomc (PPE)
text: Writing. I supported the report on the control and enforcement system used in the North East Atlantic fisheries, as the amendments concern the harmonisation of the FAO's control system with a view to preventing, limiting and eliminating illegal, unreported and legally unregulated fishing.  The measures taken by these amendments will ensure better long-term conservation and optimal exploitation of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic area, leading to lasting results consistent with environmental and social aspects.

name: Estefanía Torres Martínez (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – We voted IN FAVOUR because the proposal aims to improve legislation already adopted which seeks to ensure better long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, providing social and sustainable benefits for the environment.

name: Mylène Troszczynski (ENF)
text: In writing. The focus is on implementing recommendations from the Northeast Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAC) to improve the fight against illegal fishing. The main focus is on the landing port states, which are more capable of monitoring ships, than the flag states. I voted for this text.

name: István Ujhelyi (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 The Convention on Future Multilateral Fisheries Cooperation in North-East Atlantic Fisheries, of which the European Union is a Contracting Party, seeks to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic, thereby providing sustainable environmental and social benefits. I voted in favour of the proposal.

name: Miguel Urbán Crespo (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – We voted IN FAVOUR because the proposal aims to improve legislation already adopted which seeks to ensure better long-term conservation and optimal use of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, providing social and sustainable benefits for the environment.

name: Viktor Uspaskich (ALDE)
text: Writing. – The main amendment to Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 concerns the harmonisation and elimination of the fao agreement control system on measures relating to port State competences in order to prevent, deter and eliminate illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing. The measures introduced by this amendment will ensure the long-term conservation and optimal exploitation of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic region, thereby ensuring sustainable results for both the environment and society.

name: Ivo Vajgl (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this resolution because I support the Convention’s aim of ensuring the long-term conservation and optimum utilisation of the fishery resources of the North-East Atlantic area, providing sustainable environmental and social benefits. The main amendment to Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 concerns alignment with the FAO Agreement’s control system on measures pertaining to port State competencies in order to prevent, deter and eliminate IUU fishing. The measures provided by this amendment will ensure better long-term conservation and optimum utilisation of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, bringing lasting results from the environmental and social point of view.

name: Ramón Luis Valcárcel Siso (PPE)
text: in writing. We are talking about a proposal amending EU Regulation 1236/2010 to incorporate into Community legislation the amendments to the control regime adopted by Recommendations 15/2013 and 9/2014 of the North-East Atlantic Commission which have become binding on the contracting parties to that committee, and consequently also for the EU. The proposal has great consensus, so I think it is necessary to vote in favour.

name: Hilde Vautmans (ALDE)
text: Written. In March, the North Atlantic Fisheries Commission adopted a number of recommendations. This vote in the European Parliament will translate these recommendations into European law. These recommendations contribute to better conservation and long-term use of fish stocks. That is why I voted in favour of this proposal.

name: Marie-Christine Vergiat (GUE/NGL)
text: In writing. There are many challenges to protect marine biodiversity and sustainable development in fisheries activities. The report adopted by the European Parliament focuses on fishing in the North Atlantic area and the development of a more environmentally friendly activity. It establishes a control and coercion regime in this area that encourages states to take binding measures to prevent and eliminate illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing. This includes measures to better control ships landing in ports in controlled areas or to modernise the system to digital use, which is more likely to be monitored.  This report therefore protects threatened fisheries resources and ensures their optimal use. The eradication of illegal fishing activities can enhance the activities of a fishery that respects the rights of fishermen and smallholders while protecting the environment from marine wildlife. It is this articulation, if properly implemented, that can secure the future. So I voted for it.

name: Miguel Viegas (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. \u2012 The Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in Fisheries of the North-East Atlantic, in which the European Union is a Contracting Party, aims to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic area, providing sustainable environmental and social benefits. The main amendment to Regulation No 1236/2010 concerns the alignment of the scheme with the FAO agreement on port State measures to prevent, prevent and eliminate illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing (IUU fishing). The measures provided for in this amendment will ensure long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the Northeast Atlantic area, providing lasting environmental and social benefits. We note negatively the Commission's growing tendency to present to the two co-legislators proposals to transpose recommendations from international organisations with such short adoption deadlines that they complicate the legislative work of Parliament and the Council, which must take into account the deadlines imposed by their internal procedures. All this is detrimental to the quality of legislation.

name: Harald Vilimsky (ENF)
text: Writing. The report appears to be promising in order to ensure the long-term conservation and optimal use of the north-east Atlantic fisheries resources, thereby creating sustainable environmental and social benefits. I therefore agree with this report.

name: Jana Žitňanská (ECR)
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the proposal on future multilateral cooperation in north-east Atlantic fisheries. This cooperation will only concern the north-east Atlantic and will therefore not directly affect all Member States, but nevertheless the consequences it will have for catching certain species of fish, such as sardines, mackerel or cod, will also be significant for the populations of other Member States. The report itself transposes the content of the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission agreement into Union law and adds legal certainty as well as contributes to the fulfilment of the European Union's international obligations. And since the rules will mainly concern the avoidment of illegal fishing, monitoring or infringement procedures, I think it is right to support such an agreement.

name: Inês Cristina Zuber (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. \u2012 This proposal aims to amend eu rules transpose the control and enforcement measures adopted by the North-East Atlantic Fisheries Commission (NEAFC). The Convention for Multilateral Fisheries Cooperation in the North-East Atlantic, to which the EU is a Contracting Party, aims to ensure long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic area. To ensure the implementation of this Convention and the recommendations adopted by NEAFC, control and enforcement measures may be adopted. In 2010, the EU transposed into its law the control and coertion regime adopted by NEAFC. In 2012 and 2013, NEAFC adopted recommendations amending the control and enforcement regime to align it with the FAO Agreement on Port State Measures to prevent, prevent and eliminate illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing. The measures envisaged by this amendment aim to "ensure better long-term conservation and optimal use of fisheries resources in the North-East Atlantic area, with lasting results expected from an environmental and social point of view. Given the issue at hand and bearing in mind that we are dealing with a proposal to amend legislation already adopted, which improves it, we voted in favour.

name: Milan Zver (PPE)
text: Writing. \u2012 For a legislative resolution of the European Parliament on the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EU) No 1236/2010 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the control and enforcement system applicable in the Convention area on future multilateral cooperation in the North-East Atlantic Fisheries (COM(2015)0121-C8-0076/2015-2015/0063(COD)) that measures will ensure better long-term conservation and optimal exploitation of fishery resources in the North-East Atlantic area, leading to sustainable results consistent with environmental and social aspects.

name: Isabella Adinolfi (EFDD)
text: in writing. \u2012 Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina signed the Central European Free Trade Agreement in December 2006, with the aim of formulating fair and stable rules in trade in goods and services. As a result of Croatia's accession to the EU, Bosnia and Herzegovina should have adapted the Interim Agreement with the aim of taking into account the preferential trade with Croatia established in the previous agreement. Unlike the other countries of the Western Balkans, however, no agreement has yet been reached with Bosnia and Herzegovina on this; In fact, the country has repeatedly stated that it could make the necessary changes only in the face of further concessions from the EU. I therefore voted in favour of the report, which concerns the request to make the extension of the autonomous trade measures for Bosnia conditional on bosnia's acceptance of the adjustment of the interim agreement. I believe that Bosnia and Herzegovina should show greater commitment to the process of association with the EU.

name: Marina Albiol Guzmán (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. Previously, Bosnia signed an Association and Stabilisation Agreement with the EU that excluded fifteen agricultural products as sensitive products for Bosnia and Herzegovina. If Bosnia now accepts the trade review proposed by this Resolution, these fifteen sensitive agricultural products will be liberalized. Therefore, aware of the importance of limiting trade interference by the EU in third countries, especially those in situations of particular instability or immersed in political, social or economic processes of radical significance to its people, such as Bosnia and Herzegovina, I voted against this Resolution in order to continue to maintain the protection of these agricultural products.

name: Marie-Christine Arnautu (ENF)
text: In writing. This report relates to the proposed regulation amending Regulation (EC) No. 1215/2009 introducing preferential trade measures for participating countries and territories linked to the stabilisation and association process implemented by the European Union and suspending its application with regard to Bosnia and Herzegovina. Brussels wants to give Bosnia the means to comply with the requirements for EU membership. However, Bosnia has always been disrupted by infighting and is grimly known for having a mafia well established on its soil. Together with my colleagues from the National Front, we are totally opposed to its accession. So I voted against it.

name: Jonathan Arnott (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ This report is an application of the EU’s usual politicisation of trade. Nevertheless, I do have certain concerns with regard to Bosnia and Herzegovina myself. On balance I therefore abstained.

name: Jean Arthuis (ALDE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this deliberation because it should encourage Bosnia and Herzegovina to respect democratic principles, the rule of law and human rights, as well as the protection of minorities.

name: Zigmantas Balčytis (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this proposal for the suspension of the exceptional trade instrument for Bosnia and Herzegovina. The Commission proposal under consideration proposes to include three main amendments in the main Regulation No 1215/2009: firstly, the extension of the existing preferences until the end of 2020. The purpose of the extension is to give the beneficiary countries additional time to bring the concessions granted to them by the basic Regulation with those granted to them under the Stabilisation and Association Agreement. Secondly, the inclusion of the human rights clause in the Autonomous Trade Instruments Regulation. It allows for the suspension of preferences in cases where any beneficiary country seriously violates fundamental principles of human rights, democracy and the rule of law. Thirdly, the possibility of suspending autonomous trade measures for Bosnia and Herzegovina from 1 January 2016. I support the proposals set out above to confirm the EU's strong commitment to further integration into the EU by the countries covered by this Regulation by granting unilateral trade preferences.

name: Nicolas Bay (ENF)
text: In writing. Regulation 1215/2009 adopted in 2009 gave exceptional trade benefits until 31/12/2015 to Balkan countries in general and Bosnia in particular, including the signing of a contract for Bosnia and Herzegovina's accession to the European Union. Both the Commission's and Parliament's text proposes to extend these exceptional measures of asymmetric liberalisation of EU and Bosnian trade until 31/12/2020 when Bosnia is in a state of near-permanent political crisis, partly due to a deleterious climate that sees both mafias and Islamists prosper. The Union's objective, however, remains Bosnia's accession to the European Union. I have, of course, voted against such aberrations.

name: Hugues Bayet (S&D)
text: In writing. While Croatia joined the European Union on 1 July 2013, Bosnia and Herzegovina has not yet agreed to adapt the interim agreement to take account of the traditional preferential trade between Croatia and Croatia in the context of the European Centre Free Trade Agreement (CEFTA) that linked the two countries before 1 July 2013. As a result of this deadlock and the damage to the Union's commercial interests, the Commission proposes that exceptional trade measures against Bosnia and Herzegovina should not be automatically extended but should be subject to Bosnia and Herzegovina's agreement on the EU's methodology for adapting the interim agreement.

name: Xabier Benito Ziluaga (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – We voted AGAINST this report because Bosnia and Hezergovina are being required to put in place measures to adapt to European standards as was done with Bulgaria or Romania, but unlike in the case of these, the prospect of EU membership is not immediate , not even credible. The clause that makes the preferential trade agreement subject to human rights is welcome, but insufficient to support the text.

name: Dominique Bilde (ENF)
text: In writing. I voted against this text which, contrary to its title, takes the side of extending the exceptional trade measures in favour of Bosnia and Herzegovina until 31 December 2020 with a view to accession.  Once again, the European Union is trying to mask its failures with an ever-crazier race for enlargement, and this is how the report also proposes an asymmetrical liberalisation of trade between the Union and Bosnia: that is, the regime will be favourable for the trade of Bosnia and Herzegovina - a country yet plagued by drug trafficking and the reign of the mafia - but in no way for the Union. , already struggling in its exports. Under great declarations of intent on respect for human rights, we continue to open the doors of our market and our territory to a country in great instability, without even profiting commercially. Pure ideology that shows the suicidal blindness of the European institutions.

name: Mara Bizzotto (ENF)
text: in writing. \u2012 While I believe that the suspension of exceptional trade preferences for Bosnia and Herzegovina is not a problem for our production system, I do not agree with the premises of this report, which leaves too much room for violation of the rules and lack of control. For all these reasons, I abstained.

name: José Blanco López (S&D)
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this agreement reached with the Council for the amendment of EC Regulation No 1215/2009 on trade measures exceptional to the countries of the Western Balkans. This extends these exceptional trade measures until 2020, giving the countries concerned and the EU sufficient time to adapt the preferences granted under the Regulation to those provided for under the different ratified Stabilisation and Association Agreements. In addition, preferences granted to Bosnia and Herzegovina should be suspended from 1 January 2016 if it does not reach an agreement with the EU on the adaptation of these exceptional trade concessions to take account of traditional preferential trade between Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina under the Central European Free Trade Agreement, an adaptation that should have taken place since Croatia's accession to the EU in 2013. Finally, I support the incorporation into the Regulation of a temporary suspension clause for exceptional trade measures in the event of a serious and systematic violation of human rights, democracy and the rule of law.

name: Vilija Blinkevičiūtė (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because it confirms Parliament's position on amendments to the Regulation establishing exceptional trade measures for countries participating in or associated with the EU stabilisation and association process and suspending its application to Bosnia and Herzegovina. Trade between the EU and the Western Balkans has been liberalised under a number of Stabilisation and Association Agreements applied by the EU since 2000. After the 2013 Croatia joined the EU, Bosnia and Herzegovina has not yet agreed to adapt the Interim Agreement to take account of traditional preferential trade between Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina under the Central European Free Trade Agreement. After three rounds of negotiations, no agreement could be reached with Bosnia and Herzegovina. According to Bosnia and Herzegovina, this would only be possible if the EU offered additional concessions. In view of the situation without a solution and damage to the EU's commercial interests, the Commission proposes to provide that the automatic extension of trade measures to Bosnia and Herzegovina should not be extended automatically, but should depend on Bosnia and Herzegovina's acceptance of the EU methodology for adapting the Interim Agreement.

name: Franc Bogovič (PPE)
text: Writing. I also supported the report on the suspension of exceptional trade measures for BiH. Since July 2013, when croatia joined the EU, the latter has still not adjusted the interim agreement in terms of taking into account preferential traditional trade between those two countries under the CEFTA agreement, which connected the two countries before 1 July 2013.  BiH is also the only Western Balkan country that has not yet adopted the EU's methodology for amending trade agreements. And this despite three rounds of intense negotiations. I therefore support the position of the Commission and the rapporteur that, as a result of this pat position, autonomous trade measures for BIH are not automatically extended, but that their implementation is frozen until the agreement on the adjustment of trade concessions between the EU and BiH takes effect.  This must be acceptable to both EU Member States and CEFTA countries and, of course, BiH. Integration into the EU has stabilised the Balkans region, with trade measures playing an important role in this. I therefore really hope that BiH will also step on the path of integration, including by adapting its trade practices to the system in force in the EU.

name: Marie-Christine Boutonnet (ENF)
text: In writing. Given the political situation in Bosnia and Herzegovina in near-permanent crisis, I see no interest in the European Union extending the exceptional trade agreements that have expired with that country. Therefore, I voted against it.

name: Renata Briano (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 The liberalisation of trade between the EU and the countries of the Western Balkans is ensured through a series of stabilisation and association agreements and an interim agreement in the case of Bosnia and Herzegovina. These agreements have advantageous conditions for Balkan states, allowing unrestricted access to the EU market free of duties for most products. Unlike the free trade agreements, which provide for preferences to be granted by all parties, autonomous trade measures constitute a unilateral preferential regime in favour of the Western Balkans. The eu's unilateral preferences for Bosnia and Herzegovina are an exceptional condition, aimed at supporting bosnia and herzegovina and helping it on its path to progressive European integration. However, the continuation of this facilitated treatment is well subject to Bosnia and Herzegovina's prior acceptance of the EU-sponsored method of transparency and internal reforms for the enlargement of the free trade area.

name: Steeve Briois (ENF)
text: In writing. Since 2000, Western Balkan countries have benefited from autonomous trade measures (AMC) from the European Union. These AMMs are a unilateral preferential regime that allows them to have unlimited access to the EU market. It recommends extending these favourable trade measures for these countries until 2020 so that they have the time to align these preferences with those provided for by the ASA (Stabilization and Association Agreement) regime, which implies reciprocity between the two parties.  On the other hand, the text provides for the suspension of these preferential measures to Bosnia, which has not yet agreed to adapt its trade agreements to take account of trade with Croatia, which is now a member of the Union. Through this vote, the European Union is mainly trying to preserve Bosnia's possible accession to the Union, to which we are strongly opposed. So I voted against it.

name: Daniel Buda (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The transit measures adopted by the Union with regard to candidate countries are intended to adjust the economic, social and political pace of the latter to the realities of the Union institutions. But any transit measure is only a temporary advantage for achieving a trade framework and strengthening citizens' rights. Naturally, such concessions or their possible suspension must be seen as an impetus to accelerate the political and socio-economic reforms outlined in the 'Growth Pact', which are indispensable to the fulfilment by the Western Balkan countries of the requirements laid down in the Copenhagen criteria and in the acquis communautaire. To this end, the call on Bosnia and Herzegovina was to adapt the Interim Agreement for Preferential Trade with Croatia following its accession to the European Union on 1 July 2013.  The Commission's proposal also seeks to eliminate an existing deficiency, namely the absence of a human rights clause, or this idea should be welcomed as a practical application of the Treaties.  Because of all these considerations set out, I agree with this measure.

name: Gianluca Buonanno (ENF)
text: in writing. \u2012 Abstention vote. This is a rather technical matter and relates to trade relations between the EU and Bosnia and Herzegovina. The subject does not pose any problems in practice, but it is in principle that we prefer to give an indication of abstention. Our political position on the stabilisation and association processes between the EU and the Balkan countries is well known. This is a pretty clear opposition. In particular, Bosnia is an experiment as a communi communitist state which sees us as somewhat sceptical, especially in the twenty years of the Dayton Agreements. It is clear that, as far as trade relations are concerned, we must be consistent and view negatively the ongoing negotiations by the European Commission which, with regard to the country in question, has so far offered 'asymmetric' openings without taking into account any offensive commercial interests of neighbouring countries. Italy could rightly be regarded as a Member State interested in penetrating the Bosnian market, especially in certain sectors. But nothing at present would facilitate this possibility.

name: James Carver (EFDD)
text: in writing. – UKIP notes that the EU has a track record of economic bullying against countries that refuse to politically obey it. Bosnia is no exception and we feel that the EU should not be using trade as a political weapon.

name: Λευτέρης Χριστοφόρου (
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 We support the report on the proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EC) No 1782/2003. This Regulation should therefore be amended accordingly. We have taken into account the Commission's proposal to the European Parliament and the Council, Article 294(2) and Article 207(2) of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union, according to which the proposal was submitted to it by the Commission (C8-0039/2014), as well as Article 294(2) of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union.

name: Κώστας Χρυσόγονος (
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 We voted today on the report on the proposal for a Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EC) No 1782/2003. This Regulation should therefore be amended accordingly. The Commission's proposal does not agree with me, as I do not think we should forget the great peculiarities of the region because of the social and political unrest that has taken place in the recent past. At the same time, serious economic problems require very subtle moves in the commercial sector if we are to achieve a satisfactory result for both sides. In this light, I believe that this proposal is not the result of a thorough effort and that is why I have decided to vote against it.

name: Salvatore Cicu (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this measure. The Commission extended the benefits of Regulation 1215 of 2009 for countries in the Western Balkan region until the year 2020. These are tariff preferences in particular. The various countries have therefore reached an agreement to regulate tariff preferences with the EU following Croatia's accession. Bosnia and Herzegovina is the only country that has not reached an agreement and for this reason the Commission proposes to suspend these benefits for Bosnia from January 2016, until an agreement has been reached. Parliament's Committee on International Trade supported this approach, proposing some limited changes to the content of the human rights clause.

name: Alberto Cirio (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this proposal because I do not believe that the conditions are in place for these exceptional measures. The disagreements with Bosnia and Herzegovina arise with an invitation to adapt the preferential trade agreement with Croatia following croatia's accession to the European Union on 1 July 2013. I think I support this report because I think it is right to emphasise that the suspension of trade preferences for Bosnia and Herzegovina should be seen as an incentive to resolve the dispute with the European Union over the interim agreement. I hope, since the relationship between the EU and third countries is very close to my heart, that the new authorities in Bosnia will take advantage of the positive impetus given by the adoption of the new EU approach to that country, not least in order to resolve this outstanding problem. That is why I voted in favour of this report.

name: Lara Comi (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The overall objective of the amendments proposed by the rapporteur is to confirm the EU's effective and firm commitment to the future European integration of the countries and territories covered by this regulation by granting unilateral trade preferences. This process of European integration has proved to be the most effective instrument for ensuring stability in the region. I have therefore chosen to vote in favour of these concessions or their possible suspension, as they are a necessary condition for speeding up the path of political and socio-economic reforms linked to the 'Growth Pact', which is essential if the countries of the Western Balkans are to comply with the Copenhagen criteria and the Eu ropean Union acquis. I also agree with the rapporteur that Bosnia and Herzegovina must adapt the Interim Agreement to preferential trade with Croatia following croatia's accession to the European Union on 1 July 2013 and, at the same time, that the parties involved take into account the mutual interests linked to this issue so as to reach an agreement acceptable both to the EU Member States and to the cefta signatory countries.

name: Therese Comodini Cachia (PPE)
