We voted against the ratification of this agreement between the European Union and its Europol agency and the United Arab Emirates on the fight against terrorism and organised crime. At the procedural level, the talks between the two sides have lacked not only transparency, but also the involvement of democratically elected actors and representatives. On the substance, it is surprising that neither the agreement nor the accompanying report mentions the trade and arms trade that takes place in this region, precisely one of the most punished by terrorism at the global level. The European Union is a major arms exporter to the United Arab Emirates and we are aware of arms trafficking from the Emirates to areas under the control of the terrorist group Dáesh. Both the European Union and the United Arab Emirates look the other way and do not propose real solutions to this problem but prefer to enrich themselves by doing business with arms, so this agreement is an exercise in hypocrisy that we will not support.

name: Louis Aliot (ENF)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the report on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol, which provides for information exchanges such as expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on methods of crime prevention , participation in training activities or the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations.  To put in place an agreement on strategic cooperation with the United Arab Emirates seems to me to be wise. In addition, this report is a good move as it does not include any provisions on the exchange of personal data.

name: Pascal Arimont (PPE)
text: Writing. This resolution, which I voted in favour of, concerns strategic cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates in the fight against terrorism. The focus is on the exchange of information, in particular on expert assessments, general situation reports, the results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigations or information on methods of preventing crime. The exchange of personal data is not part of the cooperation.

name: Marie-Christine Arnautu (ENF)
text: In writing. Europol wants to conclude an agreement with the United Arab Emirates on cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism. The agreement provides for exchanges of information such as expertise, general reports, analysis results, information on criminal investigations and information on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations.  There is no provision for the protection of personal data in this agreement. Europol considers the UAE to be a benchmark for financial crime (VAT fraud, money laundering, etc.). Many criminals are said to have taken refuge there. I voted in favour of this text.

name: Jonathan Arnott (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ Rather than voting against for the usual reasons, I chose to abstain on this matter as I do not wish to oppose any attempt to support a relatively moderate regime to fight against and track extremists.

name: Zigmantas Balčytis (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this proposal, which aims to approve the Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. Information would be exchanged in the areas of expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures, methods of crime prevention, training activities, as well as advice and assistance in specific criminal investigations. I agree that cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates is necessary and that the role of the United Arab Emirates in the fight against organised crime is becoming increasingly important as the country becomes a growing centre of economic and financial crime. The agreement would help to combat and strengthen financial fraud and would contribute to international cooperation in the field of financial crime investigations and other important criminal cases.

name: Nicolas Bay (ENF)
text: In writing. According to Europol, the United Arab Emirates is becoming a major centre of financial and economic crime (VAT fraud, money laundering, etc.) and many criminals have taken refuge there. Europol therefore called for this strategic cooperation agreement against serious crime and terrorism. The terms of cooperation governed by the agreement in question provide for exchanges of information that may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on crime prevention methods, participation in training activities, and the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations. , however, without the exchange of personal data. I therefore voted in favour of concluding this agreement.

name: Hugues Bayet (S&D)
text: In writing. Parliament was to give an opinion here on a Council decision to establish a strategic cooperation agreement with the United Arab Emirates. This type of strategic agreement focuses on enhanced cooperation in strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, methods of prevention of criminal acts,... On the other hand, the agreement excludes any exchange of personal data. The European Union thereby wishes to strengthen its judicial and police cooperation with the United Arab Emirates in the fight against terrorism. This should also be useful in combating international financial crime, of which the uae has become one of the hubs. I voted in favour of this proposal.

name: Xabier Benito Ziluaga (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – We voted against it, firstly because we consider it a waste to approve this strategic cooperation agreement now, because the Council and the European Parliament are currently negotiating a new Regulation for Europol (2013/0091 (COD)), in which the procedure for concluded international agreements, as well as the relevant provisions and guarantees for the protection of the personal data of European citizens will be significantly amended. We believe that it would be preferable for this international cooperation agreement to be adopted after the entry into force of the new Europol Regulation. On the other hand, we are against this report as it underlies the double standards governing eu foreign policy with regard to the fight against terrorism in its cooperation agreements with countries such as the UAE. The EU is the second largest arms dealer in the region, weapons that have often ended up in the hands of rebel groups or terrorist groups. Consequently, we consider it hypocritical to support strategic cooperation agreements with the United Arab Emirates in the fight against terrorism if at the same time the EU arms sale is working to strengthen these terrorist groups.

name: Dominique Bilde (ENF)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text, which reflects Europol's desire to conclude an agreement with the United Arab Emirates on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism. Given the current context and the drama of recent events, this cooperation seems indispensable, especially as information exchanges are planned that may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on crime prevention methods, participation in training activities, and the provision of advice and support in certain criminal investigations. These are all imperative procedures that we have missed in recent years. I only regret that they are not extended to other countries that could be strategic partners in the fight against terrorism. Finally, with the agreement excluding the exchange of personal data, it seems to me all the more relevant to support this will of Europol.

name: Mara Bizzotto (ENF)
text: in writing. \u2012 Europol's cooperation with the United Arab Emirates is crucial to strengthening the joint fight against international organised crime in the financial and economic spheres. The Gulf countries play a leading role in this context, given the increase in the activity of criminal organisations in these regions. I therefore voted in favour of this strategic cooperation agreement.

name: José Blanco López (S&D)
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this resolution by which Parliament supports the Council Decision approving the conclusion of a strategic agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. The information exchanged could include expertise, general status reports, strategic analysis results, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods, training activities, as well as advice and support in specific criminal investigations, excluding the exchange of personal data. Europol's cooperation with the United Arab Emirates is justified by Europol's finding that the US has increasing relevance in the fight against organised crime, as Europol is becoming an increasingly important platform for economic and financial crime. The agreement will therefore support and strengthen the fight against financial fraud and contribute to improving international cooperation in the field of financial research and other important criminal matters.

name: Vilija Blinkevičiūtė (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted on this report because it supports the Council's proposal to approve the Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. This strategic agreement excludes the exchange of personal data, so the issue of data protection is irrelevant in this case. This agreement will provide for future exchanges of information in the areas of expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures, methods of crime prevention, training activities, as well as advice and assistance in specific criminal investigations. It is clear that, from an operational point of view, cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates is necessary. According to Europol, the role of the United Arab Emirates in the fight against organised crime is becoming increasingly important as the country becomes a growing centre of economic and financial crime. Proceeds from criminal activities such as value added tax fraud (VAT), intra-Community carousel fraud and money laundering are being reinvested in the United Arab Emirates, and the main operators of this fraud are seeking refuge there.

name: Franc Bogovič (PPE)
text: Writing. In the spirit of the current confrontation with terrorism and other serious crime, I support the proposed report on deepening cooperation between the EU and the United Arab Emirates in this area. The concrete proposal talks about strengthening strategic cooperation between Europol and the UsA.  It is mainly about the exchange of information on expertise, the results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures and methods for crime prevention and training, and support for individual criminal investigations. The agreement excludes the exchange of personal data.  The US is becoming an important hub for economic and financial crime, so cooperation in data sharing is of paramount importance. This is where many criminals in the area of financial crime and money laundering have sought refuge, many of whom also come from the EU, and it is therefore necessary to strengthen the control and retrieval of information.  I believe that this agreement will help and strengthen the fight against financial fraud and contribute to improving international cooperation in the area of financial investigations and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Marie-Christine Boutonnet (ENF)
text: In writing. As Europol says the UAE is increasingly becoming a centre of financial and economic crime (VAT fraud, money laundering, etc.) and that many criminals have taken refuge there, and since the strategic agreement does not include any provision for the exchange of personal data, but only provides for exchanges of information that may include expertise. , general reports, the results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations, which I believe is entirely appropriate for the situation, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Renata Briano (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 The agreement between the European Union and the United Arab Emirates on strategic cooperation between Europol and the UAE security agency is to be supported because it can help in the fight against financial fraud and can help to strengthen international cooperation in financial investigations and other relevant criminal matters, also given the nature of the important hub that the United Arab Emirates constitutes in financial trafficking in the Near and Middle East.

name: Steeve Briois (ENF)
text: In writing. This report concerns the conclusion of an agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates, which is part of operational and strategic cooperation aimed at increasing efficiency in the fight against crime and prevention.  This cooperation includes both exchange of information on criminal investigation procedures, methods of crime prevention and participation in training activities. Unlike the agreement with Bosnia and Herzegovina, it does not involve the exchange of personal data.  At a time when the United Arab Emirates is increasingly facing economic and financial delinquency, it seems to me to be quite wise to accompany them as best as possible in the fight against this scourge. So I voted for this text.

name: Daniel Buda (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The fight against crime in Europe has become a key target for the Union, given the European and international context, the intensification of terrorist attacks and the threats posed by some extremist groups. In this context, it is important to identify organised crime network centres and, even if they are outside the union area, passivity is not acceptable, but we need to get a collaboration with those key states. Since it is for the Council to approve the conclusion of international cooperation agreements with third countries, after consulting the European Parliament, the Council has proposed a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates, an initiative which can only benefit the European Police Office. Although such agreements may concern the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information and personal data, in this case the exclusion of the exchange of personal data has been chosen, so that the issue of data protection is irrelevant. I gave my vote in favour of this cooperation because it would facilitate and intensify the fight against financial fraud and would help to strengthen international cooperation in the field of financial investigations and other relevant aspects of criminal law.

name: Gianluca Buonanno (ENF)
text: in writing. \u2012 Europol's cooperation with the United Arab Emirates is motivated by clear operational needs. According to Europol, the United Arab Emirates is becoming increasingly important in the fight against organised crime, as the country is becoming an increasingly important hub for financial and economic crimes. The agreement provides for the possibility of requesting more information on financial investigations and other relevant criminal matters. For this reason, and in view of the importance of information with the Gulf countries during this period, I am voting in favour.

name: Cristian-Silviu Buşoi (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 Due to the growing need for the exchange of operational information of the European Police Office with the United Arab Emirates, this draft legislative resolution complements Europol's competences in strategic cooperation to combat serious crime and terrorism. This agreement would be beneficial for criminal investigation procedures, but also in the action we are taking to prevent crime. I would also like to stress that it is important to consider data protection in exchange for personal data. I therefore support the report on the draft Council implementing decision on the approval of Europol's conclusion of the Agreement on Strategic Cooperation to Combat Serious Crime and Terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol.

name: Nicola Caputo (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 My vote in favour of the report on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the agreement on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol because Europol's cooperation with the United Arab Emirates seems to be motivated by objective operational needs. According to Europol, the United Arab Emirates is becoming increasingly important in the fight against crime and therefore also in the fight against terrorism. The country is becoming an increasingly important hub for not only financial and economic crimes. Strategic cooperation with the United Arab Emirates as well as with other countries that have a strategic role, is an aid and support to the fight against crime and strengthens international action with regard to financial investigations as well as for all other cases of violation of the law.

name: James Carver (EFDD)
text: in writing. – UKIP commends the UAE for its role in fighting extremism and notes the strong ties that exist between the UK and the UAE. We abstained because we feel that the UK Government, and not Europol, should be the body that oversees UK intelligence and data sharing with third countries.

name: Fabio Massimo Castaldo (EFDD)
text: in writing. \u2012 The report concerns the approval of the proposal for a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. Cooperation is certainly important, but we believe that the agreement should have been concluded after the entry into force of the new Europol regulation, with reference to the updated data protection legislation currently under discussion. I have therefore chosen to abstain.

name: Caterina Chinnici (S&D)
text: in writing. \u2012 Organised crime and terrorism are two wide-ranging phenomena affecting an increasing number of European and non-European countries. For this reason, the response that the Union must give can only be sought in strengthening international cooperation and in concluding strategic and/or operational agreements with third countries. It is therefore essential, in order to take concrete action against criminal activities of various kinds, for Europol to conclude agreements with non-European states to strengthen the exchange of information, specialist knowledge, strategic analysis results, information on criminal investigation procedures and methods of preventing crime. The United Arab Emirates has now become an increasingly important hub for financial and economic crimes and large amounts of money from fraud, money laundering and other crimes have been reinvested in that country in recent years. For these reasons, I voted in favour of the report, in the hope that the Council will be able to proceed quickly with the conclusion of the agreement with the United Arab Emirates.

name: Λευτέρης Χριστοφόρου (
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 The report concerns the draft Council Implementing Decision approving the conclusion by EUROPOL of the Agreement between the United Arab Emirates and Europol on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism. We therefore approve and support the Council's position.

name: Κώστας Χρυσόγονος (
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 The report on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Agreement on strategic cooperation in combating serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol, I am opposed to it and I therefore voted against it. It is well known that Europe continues to trade arms with third states and with the Arab Emirates; That is why I voted against the report.

name: Salvatore Cicu (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report. This draft concerns the proposal to approve the conclusion of an agreement on strategic cooperation between the United Arab Emirates and Europol. This agreement excludes the exchange of personal data, which is why the issue of data protection is not relevant in this case. The information exchanged could include specialist knowledge, general situation reports, strategic analysis results, information on criminal investigation procedures and crime prevention methods, training activities, as well as advice and support in individual criminal investigations. The European Parliament is in favour of concluding this agreement on strategic cooperation with the United Arab Emirates, as it would be an aid and support to the fight against financial fraud and would help to strengthen international cooperation with regard to financial investigations and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Alberto Cirio (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report presented by Alessandra Mussolini on the draft Council implementing decision approving the agreement between the United Arab Emirates and Europol on combating terrorism and serious crime. This draft concerns the conclusion of a strategic cooperation agreement between the two parties concerned with regard to the exchange of information such as: specialist knowledge, strategic analysis reports, information on criminal investigation procedures and methods of crime prevention. This desire for cooperation stems from the fact that, according to Europol, the United Arab Emirates is gaining an increasingly important position in the fight against organised crime and the country is becoming an increasingly important hub for financial and economic crimes. I agree with the rapporteur that cooperation with this world leader in a similar field is important. the EU is right to cooperate with third countries at the summit on such sensitive issues, and this with the United Arab Emirates on terrorism and crime could be a very important alliance.

name: Carlos Coelho (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 Europol, as an information analysis centre that seeks to provide support to Member States, has at its disposal a number of instruments, including cooperation with third countries through cooperation agreements. It is up to Parliament, for the time being, to give an opinion only.  The agreement with the United Arab Emirates is of particular importance in the context of fraud and financial crime. As a growing financial hub worldwide, it seems quite clear to me that this is the case. However, cooperation is two-way, and it is also important not to transmit personal data, thus ensuring that fundamental rights of European citizens are not infringed. Furthermore, without prejudice to its obvious usefulness, the rapporteur correctly suggests that the Commission review it in the light of Europol's future legal basis. I therefore support the conclusion of the agreement in the proposed terms.

name: Lara Comi (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 According to Europol, the United Arab Emirates is gaining increasing prominence in the fight against organised crime: this is because the country is becoming the focus of financial and economic crimes. The proceeds of criminal activities are reinvested in the United Arab Emirates and the most important criminals involved in the fraud in question have sought refuge in the country. I am therefore in favour of the agreement on strategic cooperation between the United Arab Emirates and Europol because I am convinced that it represents an important aid and support to the fight against financial fraud. It would also help to strengthen international cooperation with regard to financial investigations and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Therese Comodini Cachia (PPE)
text: in writing. – My vote reflects the decision not to divulge unnecessarily sensitive information which could impinge on data protection while focusing on the primary need to strengthen the strategic cooperation agreement with the United Arab Emirates. This agreement will help in reinforcing the fight against financial fraud and contribution to enhancing international cooperation in the field of financial investigation and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Ignazio Corrao (EFDD)
text: in writing. \u2012 The proposal concerns the approval of the proposal for a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. Despite the fact that I consider cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates to be important, particularly in the fight against organised crime and terrorism, I am voting against it pending the entry into force of the new Europol regulation, which concerns cooperation agreements and provides for the exchange of sensitive personal data.

name: Javier Couso Permuy (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. We voted against the ratification of this agreement between the European Union and its Europol agency and the United Arab Emirates on the fight against terrorism and organised crime. At the procedural level, the talks between the two sides have lacked not only transparency, but also the involvement of democratically elected actors and representatives. On the substance, it is surprising that neither the agreement nor the accompanying report mentions the trade and arms trade that takes place in this region, precisely one of the most punished by terrorism at the global level. The European Union is a major arms exporter to the United Arab Emirates and we are aware of arms trafficking from the Emirates to areas under the control of the terrorist group Dáesh. Both the European Union and the United Arab Emirates look the other way and do not propose real solutions to this problem but prefer to enrich themselves by doing business with arms, so this agreement is an exercise in hypocrisy that we will not support.

name: Pál Csáky (PPE)
text: Writing. \u2012 Under the current Council Decision on Europol, the Council, after consulting the European Parliament, must approve the conclusion of international cooperation agreements with third countries or international organisations. This proposal is aimed at the proposed adoption of a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. Such a strategic agreement precludes the exchange of personal data and, consequently, the issue of data protection does not play a role in this case. The information exchanged may include the field of expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis and information on criminal investigation procedures and crime prevention methods, as well as training activities and the provision of advice and support for specific criminal investigations. According to Europol, the UAE is playing a growing role in the fight against organised crime as the country increasingly becomes a hub for economic and financial crime.  The European Parliament approved the conclusion of a strategic cooperation agreement between the United Arab Emirates and Europol, as it would help and strengthen the fight against financial fraud and contribute to international cooperation in the field of financial investigations and other relevant crimes.

name: Edward Czesak (ECR)
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 The international exchange of information on terrorism and the activities of organised crime groups is crucial for the smooth operation of the relevant services. It facilitates not only the catching of criminals, but also the carrying out of preventive measures in general. The Agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates will m.in exchange of data and expertise, the organisation of training and the carrying out of joint operations. Its entry into force will certainly contribute to improving security and making counter-terrorism and serious crime services more effective. In order to support Europol's cooperation initiative with the United Arab Emirates, I voted in favour of the report on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion of a strategic cooperation agreement in the fight against serious crime and terrorism.

name: Miriam Dalli (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ The report in question approves the Council draft, which aims to increase cooperation between Europol and the UAE in the fight against serious crime and terrorism. The cooperation excludes the exchange of personal data, and only includes specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods, training activities, and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations. As this report strikes a balance between increased co-operation and safeguarding personal data I had no issues with supporting it in plenary.

name: Daniel Dalton (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ I very much welcome this cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. The need for more international cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism has been highlighted yet again by recent tragic events in Europe. This agreement allows for the exchange of specialist knowledge, strategic analysis, information on crime-prevention methods and support in individual criminal investigations, a useful tool for both the UAE and Europol. It should also be emphasised that this strategic cooperation agreement does not include the exchange of personal data. The benefits of this deal are clear, and I am happy to support it in today’s vote.

name: Michel Dantin (PPE)
text: In writing. This report proposes the positive opinion of the European Parliament on the conclusion by the European Union of a new agreement to strengthen police cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. MEPs insisted that in the future the rules should include a revision clause for such agreements and that the European Parliament should have a say. Our aim is to ensure that the parties to the agreement fully comply with data protection standards and European police standards. Considering that this report is balanced, I voted for it.

name: William (The Earl of) Dartmouth (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP commends the UAE for its role in fighting extremism and notes the strong ties that exist between the UK and the UAE. We abstained because we feel that the UK Government, and not Europol, should be the body that oversees UK intelligence and data sharing with third countries.

name: Rachida Dati (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text for the conclusion of the Strategic Cooperation Agreement in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and the European Police Office (Europol). It is indeed essential that the European Union strengthens its cooperation with third countries to address these global challenges. The exchange of information with the United Arab Emirates must therefore be strengthened to effectively combat terrorism.

name: Gérard Deprez (ALDE)
text: In writing. I voted against the report recommending the Council's approval of the European Police Office 'Europol' approval of the agreement on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol. It would have been preferable if this agreement on strategic cooperation had been adopted after the new Europol regulation came into force. Indeed, the agency's new legal basis has significantly changed the procedure for concluding international agreements, data protection provisions and safeguards, and document classification.  This negative vote therefore does not aim at the content of the agreement, which I support without hesitation, but is intended to defend the role of Parliament and thus to ensure greater democratic control over these agreements.

name: Mireille D'Ornano (ENF)
text: In writing. The aim of this report is to promote cooperation between the European Union and the United Arab Emirates against terrorism and big banditry. By tightening cooperation through the exchange of information, analyses of common strategies, information on criminal investigation procedures and participation in joint training activities in particular, this report encourages greater efficiency in the fight against crime that is developing in this Gulf country. In addition, this report does not include provisions on the exchange of personal information. Attached to the defence of personal data as well as to the fight against financial crime, I therefore voted for this report.

name: Ангел Джамбазки (ECR)
text: in writing. \u2012 I supported the report on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol, because I believe that the United Arab Emirates is becoming increasingly important in the fight against organised crime, as according to the latest data this country is becoming a growing center for economic and financial crime.  It is also important to note that the agreement excludes the exchange of personal data and the information exchanged may include specialised knowledge, general situational reports, results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on methods of preventing criminal offences, training activities and the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations. I believe that in today's migration crisis and threat of terrorism, it is important that Europe cooperates with the maximum number of countries when it comes to combating cross-border crime and organised crime.

name: Γεώργιος Επιτήδειος (
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Any strategic cooperation agreement between the EU (Europol) and the EU lacks logic. The United States is a centre of economic and financial crime and provides refuge to perpetrators of economic crimes, while their banking system invests in profits from VAT fraud and intra-Community fraud of silent trade. To date, the UAEs operate outside all logic of prosecuting economic criminals and crimes, while their performance as the rule of law is far from Western Christian societies and countries.

name: Edouard Ferrand (ENF)
text: In writing. I voted for this deliberation because it is in the direction of a better fight against terrorism and organised crime.

name: Laura Ferrara (EFDD)
text: in writing. \u2012 Cooperation agreements between Europol and third countries, and in this case with the United Arab Emirates, to combat organised crime or terrorism, are relevant for an effective exchange of information including criminal procedures, crime prevention methods, participation in training activities and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations. It should be pointed out that a new Europol regulation will soon be in place: it would have been more appropriate to postpone the conclusion of new cooperation agreements at that time, which will be subject to the new and stricter rules included in the regulation.

name: João Ferreira (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. \u2012 This report aims to propose the establishment of a cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. The information exchanged may include expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyses, information on both criminal investigation processes and crime prevention methods, training activities, advice and support in certain criminal investigations. If, on the one hand, europol does not recognise the authority or competence to act on behalf of the Member States in this area, on the other hand, it is considered at least cynical to propose that the European Union – the second largest arms exporter to the Middle East region – and the United Arab Emirates – arms supplier to terrorist groups that have served destabilisation targets in Syria – will be in a position to engage in some serious and consistent "combat" against "serious crime" and "terrorism". By the foregoing, vote against.

name: Raffaele Fitto (ECR)
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the draft decision on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol. This cooperation agreement provides the basis for an increasingly effective and specialized exchange of information, without harming the right to protection of personal data.

name: Monika Flašíková Beňová (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 The current situation in the European Union as well as in the global global context requires the adoption of decisions involving cooperation with third States or international organisations pursuant to Article 23(2) of the Council Decision. Such cooperation and agreements may concern the exchange of strategic professional or operational information as well as classified information. Such agreements also include the exchange of personal data. From an operational point of view, we consider it necessary for EUROPOL to cooperate strategically with the UAE, although this agreement excludes the exchange of personal data. However, UAE appears to play an increasingly important role in the fight against organised crime, as economic and financial crime is growing in this country, particularly in the form of VAT fraud, fraud based on a missing business entity or money laundering.

name: Lorenzo Fontana (ENF)
text: in writing. \u2012 I support this report for cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. It is motivated by clear operational needs. According to Europol, the United Arab Emirates is becoming increasingly important in the fight against organised crime, as the country is becoming an increasingly important hub for financial and economic crimes.

name: Λάμπρος Φουντούλης (
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 Any strategic cooperation agreement between the EU (Europol) and the EU lacks logic. The United States is a centre of economic and financial crime, a haven for criminals in economic crimes and their banking system invests in profits from VAT fraud and intra-Community hidden trade fraud. So far, the UAE has operated outside the logic of prosecuting economic criminals and crimes, and their performance as the rule of law is far from Christian societies and western states. For the above reasons I am voting against this report.

name: Ashley Fox (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report as cooperation with other states is the right way to fight serious crime and terrorism.  To keep our borders safe and fight against terrorism we must be willing to work with others. Information sharing, where necessary, can enhance both security at home and abroad. I am particularly happy with this agreement as no personal data will be shared.

name: Doru-Claudian Frunzulică (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I welcome the proposed approval of a strategic cooperation agreement between the European Union and the United Arab Emirates with the purpose of fighting against serious crime and terrorism, which shall include specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime-prevention methods, training activities, and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations. There is a clear need to cooperate with the United Arab Emirates on the issue to avoid that the country becomes a growing hub for economic and financial crime.  This agreement would aid and reinforce the fight against financial fraud and would contribute to enhancing international cooperation in the field of financial investigation and other relevant criminal matters. I support the call on the Commission to inform the Parliament and the Council of the outcome of the assessment on the cooperation agreement and, if appropriate, to submit a recommendation for an authorisation to open international renegotiation of the agreement.

name: Mariya Gabriel (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the Strategic Cooperation Agreement in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol because it is in line with a strengthening of Europol, which must have the necessary means to have real added value in this area. The strategic cooperation agreement with the United Arab Emirates is essential, as the country is an essential partner as a focal point in the fight against multiple criminal activities.  The agreement will also improve multilateral cooperation between the United Arab Emirates, Member States and Europol in the fight against terrorism, which needs to be strengthened.  Finally, this agreement respects the principle of proportionality because it excludes the transfer of personal data and is limited to the exchange of strategic information.

name: Kinga Gál (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ There are clear operational needs for Europol to cooperate with the United Arab Emirates, since according to Europol, the United Arab Emirates are increasingly relevant in the fight against organised crime. This proposal concerns the proposed approval of a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. Such agreements may concern the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information. The operational cooperation agreement also includes the exchange of personal data. We support this strategic cooperation agreement with the United Arab Emirates, since it would aid and reinforce the fight against financial fraud and would contribute to enhancing international cooperation in the field of financial investigation and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Ildikó Gáll-Pelcz (PPE)
text: Writing. \u2012 Pursuant to Article 23(2) of the current Council Decision on Europol (Decision 2009/371/IB), it is for the Council, after consulting the European Parliament, to approve the conclusion of international cooperation agreements with third countries or international organisations. Such an agreement may relate to the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information. The operational cooperation agreement also includes the exchange of personal data. This proposal is aimed at the proposed adoption of a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. Such a strategic agreement precludes the exchange of personal data and, consequently, the issue of data protection does not play a role in this case. The information exchanged may include the field of expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis and information on criminal investigation procedures and crime prevention methods, as well as training activities and the provision of advice and support for specific criminal investigations. I voted in favour of the conclusion of a strategic cooperation agreement between the UAE and Europol, as it would help and strengthen the fight against financial fraud and contribute to international cooperation in the field of financial investigations and other relevant crimes.

name: Francesc Gambús (PPE)
text: in writing. I voted in favour considering that the United Arab Emirates has increasing relevance in the fight against organized crime. In order to combat organized crime and terrorism, cooperation between the United Arab Emirates and Europol is absolutely essential, always bearing in mind respect for human rights.

name: Arne Gericke (ECR)
text: Writing. I voted today in favour of the report on strategic cooperation between the United Arab Emirates and Europol in the fight against serious crime and terrorism, as I believe that the approach to combating global connected terror is important, while at the same time making it clear to Parliament that this dialogue does not involve the exchange of personal data. At the same time, it is important to me to see this type of cooperation for itself. It does not disguise the fact that the United Arab Emirates continues to violate fundamental and human rights, which Europe cannot tolerate, even in view of the forthcoming World Cup.

name: Jens Gieseke (PPE)
text: Writing. The United Arab Emirates is becoming increasingly important for the successful fight against organised crime. Closer cooperation is therefore important and forward-looking.

name: Neena Gill (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this proposal, which concerns strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. Such strategic agreement excludes the exchange of personal data, so the issue of data protection is not relevant in this case. The information exchanged could include specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime-prevention methods, training activities, and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations.

name: Bruno Gollnisch (NI)
text: In writing. According to the reasons for Mrs Mussolini's report, this strategic cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates is motivated by the increasingly important role of Europol and the United Arab Emirates in economic and financial crime and the presence on their soil of the many criminals involved in these operations, who take refuge there. In these circumstances, the prosecution and apprehension of these criminals does require information exchange and cooperation. France has already concluded agreements with the UAE in the late 2000s on mutual legal assistance in criminal matters and cooperation in internal security matters. As for the UAE, it seems that they are already cooperating widely with Interpol. This agreement is therefore probably of little interest to my country, but it is not necessarily the case for all the Member States of the European Union.  Moreover, I disapprove of its conclusion by Europol, a mere agency, even if it requires the formal approval of the Council. However, I will not object to that.

name: Tania González Peñas (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. U2012 We voted against it, firstly because we consider it a waste to approve this strategic cooperation agreement now, because the Council and the European Parliament are currently negotiating a new Regulation for Europol (2013/0091 (COD)), in which the procedure for concluded international agreements, as well as the relevant provisions and guarantees for the protection of the personal data of European citizens will be significantly amended. We believe that it would be preferable for this international cooperation agreement to be adopted after the entry into force of the new Europol Regulation. On the other hand, we are against this report as it underlies the double standards governing eu foreign policy with regard to the fight against terrorism in its cooperation agreements with countries such as the UAE. The EU is the second largest arms dealer in the region, weapons that have often ended up in the hands of rebel groups or terrorist groups. Consequently, we consider it hypocritical to support strategic cooperation agreements with the United Arab Emirates in the fight against terrorism if at the same time the EU arms sale is working to strengthen these terrorist groups.

name: Theresa Griffin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Earlier we voted on a visa waiver of 90 days with the UAE for EU citizens, this represented an important step towards enhancing our cooperation and relations with Abu Dhabi. While it is regrettable that Parliament has only been given a consultative role, it is an important sign of approval from this place, nevertheless.

name: Nathan Gill (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP commends the UAE for its role in fighting extremism and notes the strong ties that exist between the UK and the UAE. We abstained because we feel that the UK Government, and not Europol, should be the body that oversees UK intelligence and data sharing with third countries.

name: Antanas Guoga (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I have not in favour of the report on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Agreement on Strategic Cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol. This proposal for a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and United Arab Emirates should provide the exchange of information including specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime-prevention methods, training activities, and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations, but I believe that it would be right to await for a new agreement under the terms of the new Europol regulation, which would give the EP a stronger role in the process and offer enhanced safeguards.

name: Τάκης Χατζηγεωργίου (
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 We voted against this report on Europol's promoted strategic cooperation with the United Arab Emirates in the fight against serious crime and terrorism, as it does not address key issues of EU-UAE relations. In essence, hypocrisy cannot go unnoticed. On the one hand, the EU concludes cooperation agreements to combat terrorism with the Gulf countries and, on the other hand, the EU is the second largest arms supplier in the region, at a time when there is a heap of information that these weapons end up in the hands of extremist fundamentalist groups. It should be noted that in 2014 the UNITED STATES was the 4th largest buyer of weapons in the world. At the same time and on a number of issues, the conclusion of this cooperation on the basis of the relevant Council Decision of 2009 ignores the fact that consultations are currently under way on a new Europol regulation. The new regulation is expected to significantly alter the procedure for concluding such international agreements as well as the privacy provisions of European citizens. The proposed agreement should therefore be concluded under the provisions of the new regulation.

name: Brian Hayes (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report because the vitally important information exchanged could include specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime-prevention methods, training activities, and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations. There seem to be clear operational needs for Europol to cooperate with the United Arab Emirates. According to Europol, the United Arab Emirates are increasingly relevant in the fight against organized crime as that country is becoming a growing hub for economic and financial crime. Proceeds from criminal activities such as VAT fraud, Missing Trader Intra Community (MTIC) fraud and Money Laundering have been reinvested in the United Arab Emirates and key criminals involved in these frauds have sought refuge there. This strategic cooperation agreement with the United Arab Emirates would aid and reinforce the fight against financial fraud and would contribute to enhancing international cooperation in the field of financial investigation and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Hans-Olaf Henkel (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ The terms of the cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates are covered by the Strategic Agreement and provide for the exchange of information (specialist knowledge, information on crime-prevention methods, results of strategic analysis...), participation in training activities and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations. The exchange of personal data is not covered by the agreement. I have voted in favour of this report because I support this cooperation as dictated by the Strategic Agreement. By the way, I believe that the euro must be abolished. It leads to dissension and discord in Europe.

name: Brice Hortefeux (PPE)
text: In writing. I supported the adoption of the Mussolini report on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol. The aim of this agreement is to support the action of the competent authorities of the Member States and their mutual cooperation in the prevention of organised crime, terrorism and other serious forms of crime. The news proves how important cooperation in these areas is.  Furthermore, the strategic agreement does not include any provisions on the exchange of personal data, which should reassure those who feared that the personal data of European citizens would be transferred to a state whose level of data protection is not equivalent to that of the European Union.

name: Cătălin Sorin Ivan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report regarding the  strategic cooperation agreement with the United Arab Emirates, since it would aid and reinforce the fight against financial fraud and would contribute to enhancing international cooperation in the field of financial investigation and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Ivan Jakovčić (ALDE)
text: Written. ‒ I voted against the European Parliament's draft legislative resolution on the Council's draft implementing decision authorising Europol to conclude a strategic cooperation agreement on serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol, because the appropriate structure of Europol has not yet been established, and at the same time this is the position of the ALDE Group.

name: Jean-François Jalkh (ENF)
text: In writing. Europol wants to conclude an agreement with the United Arab Emirates on cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism. The agreement provides for exchanges of information such as expertise, general reports, analysis results, information on criminal investigations and information on crime prevention methods, participation in training activities, and the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations.  It is regrettable that this agreement does not provide for any provision for the protection of personal data. Europol considers the UAE to be a benchmark for financial and economic offenders. So I voted for it.

name: Diane James (EFDD)
text: in writing. – My colleagues and I commends the UAE for its role in fighting extremism and notes the strong ties that exist between the UK and the UAE. I abstained because we feel that the UK Government, and not Europol, should be the body that oversees UK intelligence and data sharing with third countries.

name: Marc Joulaud (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of my colleague Alessandra Mussolini's report on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol. It is an agreement to lead the cooperation of the European Union and the UAE in the prevention of organised crime and terrorism in particular. It is essential today to take effective action and protect people. This strategic agreement, however, does not deal with an exchange of personal data. This resolution was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Barbara Kappel (ENF)
text: Writing. The report provides for cooperation on an exclusively strategic basis, including the fight against financial crime. That is why I agree with the report.

name: Afzal Khan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the agreement as it will aid and reinforce the fight against financial fraud and would contribute to enhancing international cooperation in the field of financial investigation and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Stelios Kouloglou (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. ‒ This report deals with the proposed approval of a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates (UAE). The agreement aims at exchanging information that includes general situation reports and analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures and on crime-prevention methods, training and support in individual criminal investigations, but excludes the exchange of personal data. According to Europol the need to cooperate with this country is relevant, as it is becoming a growing hub for economic and financial crime. I recognise that this agreement would reinforce the fight against financial fraud and enhance international cooperation in relevant matters. However, it would be preferable to proceed with its adoption after the entry into force of the provisions of the new Europol Regulation. Additionally, no mention has been made of the involvement of the EU in dealing arms to that region. Therefore, I voted against this report.

name: Béla Kovács (NI)
text: Writing. – The UAE is increasingly becoming a hub for economic and financial crime, according to Europol. Proceeds from crimes such as VAT fraud, fraud by a trader disappearing within the EU and money laundering are often re-investing there, and criminals involved in these frauds have also found refuge there. Like all reports on the judiciary, the fight against corruption and crime, I voted in favour of this.

name: Giovanni La Via (PPE)
text: in writing. Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, as Europol has explained, the United Arab Emirates has an increasingly central role to play in the fight against organised crime. This consideration is supported by data on the flow of money from criminal activities, which are reinvested in the country, which it is the duty to identify, block and trace back to those responsible for criminal acts. I have decided to give my positive opinion because I believe that this agreement will enable both parties to conduct more accurate investigations through the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information.

name: Marine Le Pen (ENF)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the report on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol. This is a strategic agreement, not an operational one. There is no provision in the strategic agreement for the exchange of personal data, which would be unacceptable. According to Europol, the United Arab Emirates is increasingly becoming a centre of financial and economic crime (VAT fraud, money laundering, etc.). Many criminals are said to have taken refuge there.

name: Gilles Lebreton (ENF)
text: In writing. FN MPs voted in favour of the agreement with the United Arab Emirates as part of a counter-terrorism strategy.

name: Philippe Loiseau (ENF)
text: In writing. Europol wants to conclude an agreement with the United Arab Emirates on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism.  The intent is defensible, and so are the terms of this agreement: they provide for exchanges of information that may include expertise, reports, results of strategic analyses, and information on criminal investigation procedures. Similarly, the agreement would allow for the exchange of information on crime prevention methods, participation in training activities, and the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations. Finally, there is no provision in the strategic agreement on the exchange of personal data, which would be unacceptable and would obviously have made me object to this text. For these various reasons, I voted for this report, which is part of the policy of combating crime and terrorism that I defend.

name: Antonio López-Istúriz White (PPE)
text: in writing. This report stems from the need for international cooperation to combat organised crime and, in particular, economic and financial crime.  It is therefore considered appropriate to approve a strategic agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates enabling the exchange of information on criminal investigation procedures and crime prevention methods, as well as advice and support in specific criminal investigations. It is worth noting the country's willingness to contribute to the fight against serious crime and terrorism. This strategic agreement will exclude the exchange of personal data, so the issue of data protection in this case is not considered relevant.  In my view, the conclusion of this agreement is necessary as it strengthens the fight against fraud by dealing with offences such as VAT fraud, intra-Community fraud and money laundering, as well as increasing international cooperation in financial investigation matters.

name: Petr Mach (EFDD)
text: Writing. \u2012 International police cooperation is to be negotiated between Member States, as interpol works.

name: Ivana Maletić (PPE)
text: Written. ‒ There is a need for Europol to cooperate with the United Arab Emirates as, according to Europol, the United Arab Emirates is increasingly relevant in the fight against organised crime. I supported the conclusion of this strategic cooperation agreement, as it can greatly help to strengthen the fight by the Member States of the Union against organised crime.  The exchange of information and knowledge includes the exchange of expertise, general reports, the results of strategic analyses, information on criminal proceedings and ways of preventing crime, and the provision of advice and support in individual criminal investigations.

name: Andrejs Mamikins (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 The most effective way to combat crime in a planned and qualitative way, especially at international level, is to cooperate closely between the partners involved or other interested partners. The exchange of experience, strategic analyses, reviews, investigative and training methods used, as well as other forms of information, is very important and necessary. This applies to administrative matters, criminal cases, the fight against terrorism, the fight against trafficking in drugs and distribution, or to counterfeiting of banknotes. In recent years, the role of the territory of the United Arab Emirates as one of the centres for coordinating, financing or implementing crime in the region and even the world has increased considerably. Not least of these crimes affect the European Union in one way or another. The UAE has demonstrated that they can cooperate effectively on a number of issues, so that, in parallel with the agreement on short-stay visa waiver, it would be perfectly logical to give the Council the right to allow Europol to conclude with the UAE agreement on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism.

name: Vladimír Maňka (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 The United Arab Emirates is becoming a country to which funds derived from crime flow, in particular money laundering, tax fraud and organised crime. The agreement between the United Arab Emirates and the European Police Office (Europol) on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism by Europol can help to detect and prevent such illegal activity through the exchange of information. The agreement excludes the exchange of personal data.

name: Νότης Μαριάς (
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report on the draft Council implementing decision on the adoption by the European Police Office (Europol) of the agreement on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol, because it is not complete and documented and on the reasons I mentioned in detail in my speech on 14/12/2015 to the plenary of the European Parliament.

name: David Martin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this proposal.There seem to be clear operational needs for Europol to cooperate with the United Arab Emirates. According to Europol, the United Arab Emirates are increasingly relevant in the fight against organized crime as that country is becoming a growing hub for economic and financial crime. Proceeds from criminal activities such as Value Added Tax (VAT) fraud, Missing Trader Intra Community (MTIC) fraud and Money Laundering have been reinvested in the United Arab Emirates and key criminals involved in these frauds have sought refuge there.

name: Dominique Martin (ENF)
text: In writing. I voted for this resolution. The European Union is for once demonstrating a good initiative by establishing strategic cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates to combat serious crime and terrorism. This agreement provides for the exchange of information and support in the event of specific criminal investigations.  Although this text suits us because the UAE is becoming a centre of financial and economic delinquency where many criminals find refuge, it should be stressed that this text does not contain any provisions on the exchange of personal data, which is unacceptable.

name: Barbara Matera (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 The draft in question relates to the proposal to approve the conclusion of an agreement on strategic cooperation between the United Arab Emirates and Europol. The exchange of personal data is excluded from this agreement. This evidence justifies the absence of data protection measures. I agree with the decision to include in the agreement the exchange of any specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures and crime prevention methods, training activities, as well as advice and support in the context of individual criminal investigations, and I therefore support her proposal.

name: Gabriel Mato (PPE)
text: in writing. We welcome the agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates in the European Parliament, as it will support and strengthen the fight against financial fraud and contribute to improving international cooperation in the field of financial research and other important criminal matters.

name: Georg Mayer (ENF)
text: Writing. This is an exclusively strategic cooperation. This cooperation can help to combat financial crime. It could also be helpful in its approach to combating terrorism and other serious crime. I therefore agree with this report.

name: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (GUE/NGL)
text: In writing. This proposal concerns the approval of a strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. However, the report states that "this country occupies an increasingly central place in the sector of economic and financial crime. Gains from criminal activities such as VAT fraud, intra-community fraud ed the failed operator and money laundering have been reinvested in the United Arab Emirates, and the main criminals involved in these operations have taken refuge in the country." So how do we fight white-collar crime with those who contribute to it?  In fact, the report forgets to mention that this eagerness to cooperate with the United Arab Emirates is directly correlated with european export forecasts in these states (up 2.1% for France in 2014 for 4.1 billion euros). This demonstrates the total hypocrisy of the European Union, which is the second largest arms exporter in the region, even though investigative reports by journalists and NGOs show that these same weapons are then sold or exchanged to fundamentalist rebel groups and terrorists.  I vote against this incondic text.

name: Joëlle Mélin (ENF)
text: In writing. Europol wants to conclude an agreement with the United Arab Emirates on cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism. The agreement provides for exchanges of information such as expertise, general reports, analysis results, information on criminal investigations and information on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations.  It is regrettable that this agreement does not provide for any provision for the protection of personal data. Europol considers the UAE to be a benchmark for financial and economic offenders. So I voted for it.

name: Nuno Melo (PPE)
text: in writing. The United Arab Emirates, according to Europol, is increasingly important in the fight against organised crime as they are increasingly becoming a platform for economic and financial crime. I voted in favour of the report on strategic cooperation in combating serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol.

name: Roberta Metsola (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I chose to support this resolution as it aims to ensure that the competent and relevant authorities designated by the United Arab Emirates and Europol share information. This interconnectivity enables border guards to identify people with either fraudulent or no documents.

name: Louis Michel (ALDE)
text: In writing. On Wednesday, the European Parliament was consulted on the future international agreement establishing operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. However, this agreement should be based on the future Europol regulation, which will give the European Parliament more powers and ensure better safeguards, particularly in the area of personal data protection.  I have therefore joined the majority of Members of my group in making use of the voice given here in Parliament to protest against the conclusion of such an agreement until the new Europol regulation is in force. Although totally in favour of cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates, we wanted to send a clear signal and defend Parliament's role in such essential issues as cooperation in the fight against crime and trafficking.

name: Miroslav Mikolášik (PPE)
text: Writing. \u2012 Since transnational organised crime is one of the greatest security threats to be combated effectively, I welcome the report on the proposal for a Council Implementing Decision approving the conclusion by Europol of an agreement between the United Arab Emirates and the European Police Office on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism. Protecting citizens' security is logically becoming one of the European Union's priorities, so it is essential to promote cooperation with all the countries involved. In doing so, experience has shown that, from an operational point of view, Europol also needs to cooperate with the United Arab Emirates, as they play an increasingly important role in the fight against organised crime. This country is becoming a growing centre of economic and financial crime. While the proceeds of crime, such as value added tax fraud or money laundering, have been reinvested in the United Arab Emirates, key perpetrators involved in those scams have resorted to the country.

name: Marlene Mizzi (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the Strategic Cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol on the condition that agreement will be reviewed once the Europol Regulation comes into force to check its legality against current standards.

name: Csaba Molnár (S&D)
text: Writing. \u2012 The Council proposed the adoption of a Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. Europol has a clear operational need to cooperate with the UAE. The country is playing a growing role in the fight against organised crime as it increasingly becomes a centre of economic and financial crime. Proceeds from crimes such as VAT fraud, fraud by a disappearing trader in the Community and money laundering are re-investing in the UAE, and key figures involved in these frauds have also found refuge here. In its report, the Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs recommends that Parliament approve the conclusion of the Strategic Cooperation Agreement, as it would help and strengthen the fight against financial fraud and contribute to international cooperation in the field of financial investigations and other relevant crimes. I voted in favour of the proposal.

name: Cláudia Monteiro de Aguiar (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 This proposal aims at concluding a strategic cooperation agreement to combat serious crime and terrorism between the European Police Service (Europol) and the United Arab Emirates.  The United Arab Emirates, according to Europol, is increasingly important in the fight against organised crime, as it is increasingly becoming a platform for economic and financial crime, including capital from criminal activities such as value added tax (VAT) fraud, fictitious operator intra-Community fraud (MTIC), money laundering and the fact that the main criminals involved in these frauds seek refuge there. I endorse the rapporteur's position, as the conclusion of the agreement will make a contribution and strengthen the fight against financial fraud, while also contributing to intensifying international cooperation in the field of financial research and other relevant areas in criminal matters.

name: Sophie Montel (ENF)
text: In writing. This report concerns the conclusion of an agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism. This cooperation would be based on exchanges of information that may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyses, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations, but not the exchange of personal data.  This cooperation is motivated by the fact that the United Arab Emirates is increasingly home to white-collar criminals who practice financial and economic crime (VAT fraud, money laundering, etc.).  I therefore voted in favour of this text.

name: Claude Moraes (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report which would strengthen the EU’s strategic cooperation agreement with the United Arab Emirates, would aid and reinforce the fight against financial fraud and would contribute to enhancing international cooperation in the field of financial investigation and other relevant criminal matters.

name: Nadine Morano (PPE)
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report on strategic cooperation between the United Arab Emirates and Europol. The aim is to improve the fight against serious crime and terrorism by organising the action and mutual cooperation of the competent authorities in the Member States and the United Arab Emirates.

name: József Nagy (PPE)
text: Writing. \u2012 While most citizens have not recovered from the recent terrorist attacks, the European Union, together with its agencies, must be ready for any possible threat. The EU's law enforcement authority, the European Police Office (Europol), plays a particularly important role in this, with the main aim of creating a secure Europe.  Since I believe that it is our job to provide Europol with all the tools to increase the efficiency of its work, I am voting in favour of concluding a strategic agreement with the UAE.  Activities relating to the collection, exchange or analysis of information form an essential part of the Office's work. Thanks to international cooperation agreements with third countries, Europol can gain experience in analyses, strategic reports and crime prevention methods that can then lead to serious results.

name: Victor Negrescu (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted for this report on the operational needs for Europol to cooperate with the United Arab Emirates. Europol statements show that the United Arab Emirates are increasingly relevant in the fight against organised crime as that country is becoming a growing hub for economic and financial crime.

name: Franz Obermayr (ENF)
text: Writing. I would have voted in favour of this report in the European Parliament. It is an agreement on police cooperation between Europol and Bosnia and Herzegovina and between Europol and the United Arab Emirates. In future, the rules will be extended by a review clause in which Members would have a say. I would have voted in favour of this cooperation, as a review clause makes perfect sense and checks whether certain rules and standards are being complied with.

name: Urmas Paet (ALDE)
text: Writing. \u2012 I abstained. Although this is a good agreement, it has been prepared in the framework of the old Europol Regulation, which will soon be replaced by a new one. However, the agreement should be concluded within the framework of the new Regulation.

name: Rolandas Paksas (EFDD)
text: Writing. – I voted in favour of this report and welcome the conclusion of the agreement. In view of the current situation and the ever-increasing threat of terrorism, cooperation between Europol and the United Arab Emirates is essential. It should be noted that the fight against terrorism in the European Union is a priority.  In order to increase the effectiveness of preventing and combating serious crime, it is necessary to support and strengthen the actions of the competent authorities of the Member States and cooperation between them.  I believe that this agreement will strengthen the fight against financial fraud. It is also a highly effective tool for strengthening international cooperation in the field of financial crime investigations and other important criminal cases.

name: Margot Parker (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP commends the UAE for its role in fighting extremism and notes the strong ties that exist between the UK and the UAE. We abstained because we feel that the UK Government, and not Europol, should be the body that oversees UK intelligence and data sharing with third countries.

name: Aldo Patriciello (PPE)
text: in writing. \u2012 I have decided to support the approval of this strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and the UAE, as I believe it can be a useful tool for combating financial and economic crime. I am therefore voting in favour.

name: Marijana Petir (PPE)
text: Written. ‒ I support the establishment of strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism between the United Arab Emirates and Europol, as this leads to close cooperation in combating asymmetric security challenges. There are clear operational needs for cooperation between the two sides due to the importance of the United Arab Emirates in the fight against organised crime and the fact that the area has become a major hub for economic and financial crime. Proceeds from criminal activity, fraud and money laundering are reinvested in the United Arab Emirates and some of the key criminals in the fraud ring are sheltered there.  This agreement contributes to the fight against financial fraud at international level and is the basis for strengthening international cooperation in the area of financial investigations and other relevant criminal proceedings. In addition, existing regional threats (terrorism, illegal oil trade, human trafficking, destabilisation of political systems) require significant engagement by the European Union institutions with a view to stabilising the area and reducing the pressure of challenges towards the European continent.

name: Florian Philippot (ENF)
text: In writing. This report concerns the conclusion of an agreement between Europol and the United Arab Emirates on strategic cooperation in the fight against serious crime and terrorism.
